Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with very good service”
Reviews.Author: Radoslaw C
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at great location. 2 minutes walk from Opera and its metro station. 10 mins to Royal Palace and walking distance to many Madrid attractions like Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, Mercado de San Miguel etc. We stayed at Junior Suite - 2 rooms suite - big enough, very comfortable and convenient. Room service was very good. Staff at reception desk - very friendly and helpful. If we should indicate minuses : small matter : rather complicated system with turning on TV (you must go via satelite / DVD module - not easy to catch it by yourself) BIG MINUS: coffee at breakfast. Something really not to our taste and not drinkable. Actually when you are in countries like Spain, Italy etc you have good reasons to expect one of their wonders: excellent coffee. At Meninas they serve coffee in flask (thermos) with hot / cold milk in other flasks. BRRR !. Why 4 star hotel is not offering you a coffee from a proffesional coffee machine with nice cream, taste etc ??? To Management of Meninas Hotel: please purchase such machine and we are sure that it will turn your hotel into 4,5 star and to the full satisfaction of your guests

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in central Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Edgecombek
Reviews.Content: The hotel has it all - great location, great room, great service, great breakfast! We found we could easily walk everywhere from the hotel. We ate breakfast everyday and enjoyed the plentiful buffet. Our room was generously sized. There was a little street noise but overall it is a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull time in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SRK99
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Meninas in September 2010 - Everything was simply perfect, beautifull hotel in the center of Madrid, next to Opera house, rich breakfast and nicely decorated rooms, great bathroom....would stay here again and hope to come back to Madrid someday soon. Have to say also that receptionists were very helpfull and aranged the transfer to airport for us and gave us many usefull advice on what to see while in Madrid. Thank you Meninas staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel w/terrific management team”
Reviews.Author: oberjas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Meninas is a small boutique located on a relatively quiet street toward the western side of the downtown area just north of the Opera Metro station. As a result, it provides a convenient base to explore Madrid. The location is in easy walking distance to Retiro Market, Plaza Del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palacio Real amongst other attractions. The hotel itself is nicely furnished, well maintained and spotlessly clean. I do have three suggestions: First, there should be a means to adjust the air conditioning, which was set too warm for these US tastes (The system has an override that does not allow a setting below 22C, regardless of what the thermostat allows, which if the setting was properly calibrated would be comfortable. Unfortunately there is no possibility the system was producing anywhere near 22C/72F air. The thermostat on my luggage read 80F.) Of greater concern was the staffs relative indifference and unwillingness to adjust the over ride. The second proposal would be to improve the coverage and speed of the WiFi, which was only available in the lobby, was very slow and had narrow bandwidth. The last recommendation would be to raise the subdued lighting in the rooms. Nevertheless, the staff was generally helpful and all seemed to have exceptional working knowledge of local restaurants and interesting shops that they were happy to share. The ownership should be especially recognized for even more attentive and committed customer service. I was exceptionally impressed by, Daniel He personally and patiently assisted me and my family to send a package back home (whew, far more bureaucratic than anything we would ever tolerate in the US). He was gracious, kind, patient and clearly committed to taking special care of his guests. Notwithstanding the aforementioned suggestions, I would absolutely recommend Hotel Meninas. It’s a delightful property in a terrific neighborhood that is fairly priced and provides an excellent location for exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ProseccoGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me and I was really pleased that I took the advice. I stayed for 3 nights with my 14 year old son. The room was decorated very nicely and the bathroom was lovely. Breakfast was good but the hot food was the same every day, a bit more choice would have been nice. Staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. Wi-fi weak and kept dropping out. The hotel is located very close to the Opera Metro station with lots of shops and places to eat nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay here agin. When I booked there was a deal of 4 nights for the price of 3. Used the hotel shuttle bus to go to the airport when we left, 13 Euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: DonQuixote1965
Reviews.Content: The rooms aren't huge, but stylish fit outs and quality bathrooms. Breakfast was great, a daily highlight. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Wifi a bit weak, even in lobby. Excellent location, close to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Bernard B
Reviews.Content: Very good central location for this hotel. The decoration is really nice and classy, the staff is more than helpful and friendly. I staid there with my 2 boys (11 and 14) and we booked the 3-bed room, it was just perfect. The only "negative" thing : the noise at night in the street when collecting the garbage... but this is normal in Madrid ! I would definitely recommend this place !

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: Well located, near to the opera metro, its a really well decorated hotel! We have stayed for two nights, ieal for a romantic weekend. We almost felt like we were home, but more luxurious. Good breakfast, pleasant staff! I would definetely will recomend it and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: javicab
Reviews.Content: This was a great location right next to the opera metro and a short walk to the royal palace and the Puerta del Sol with heaps of shops and bars in between. The staff were very helpful. The junior suites where we stayed were very modern, spacious and clean. Without a doubt would go back to Hotel Meninas.

Reviews.Title: “Generally very pleasant but poor breakfast experience”
Reviews.Author: Mr I
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for a few nights every summer for the past three years. The Hotel is clean and smart and the location is fantastic. The staff all have excellent English and are always polite and helpful. The rooms are all a little on the compact side but are well furnished, light and comfortable. I would have given this hotel top marks however over my trips I have noticed that they are steadily reducing the offering at breakfast from once once a plush and abundant array of everything and anything you could think of, arranged beautifully and with care, towards a more sparse 'ready made' prepackaged feel. But by far the worst thing about breakfast on my most recent trip was the mess. The breakfast room was coming down with dirty plates and tables - some lying there caked in scraps of food for up to an hour (I initially left when I saw the mess to give them a chance to clean up - but 40 mins later when I came back, nothing had moved, just even more mess! . I witnessed people having to clear tables themselves as 15 of the 18 tables were completely covered in dirty plates etc, and the other three tables were occupied by other guests. It was truly shocking. The lady who was attending to breakfast seemed to be completely unbothered by the unhygienic swamp that had amassed and had no interest in clearing up. She would disappear for 15 minutes and then arrive with a plate of cheese, and then vanish again, leaving us to fend for ourselves among the mess. It was so bad that I complained, and on my final day there was an improvement but still wasn't ideal by any means. If they got the breakfast right it would be a first rate hotel and an all round excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Meninas two weeks ago (mid July, 2012) for four nights and were very happy with the hotel. It is just off of Plaza Isabel, a few blocks from the Plaza Mayor, San Miguel market (fantastic upscale food market), and just a few more blocks from Cava Baja street and Plaza de La Paja, which have a great nightlife of restaurants and bars. The hotel is half block from the Opera metro station (Madrid has an extensive and easy to use metro system) and is very close to the Royal palace. The hotel is reasonably priced, the rooms are very clean and nicely appointed, and the breakfast is good buffet style - an easy way to start the day. The overall vibe is boutique chic, somewhat modernist. The staff are friendly and speak English. We will definitely stay here again when we return and I would happily recommend this to anyone who is visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor plumbing, stale breakfast, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: Alex J
Reviews.Content: The location is great and some of the staff tried to be very helpful. Overall though this was the one "dud" of our trip. Issues began the first night we arrived when we were told the double bed we'd requested (and been told was available) wasn't actually available. They told us they'd take care of it the next day though, so we didn't mind too much. Then the sink plug in the bathroom got stuck so the sink wouldn't drain, and no one working that evening knew how to fix it. So we got to wash our hands, brush our teeth, etc., in the shower -- you never appreciate how helpful a sink is until you don't have one. The breakfast looked very good the next morning, but wasn't. Eggs were cold, pastries appeared to be pre-packaged, dry, and sickly sweet -- very different from what we were used to with spanish baked goods. The hot water for tea was luke warm at best. They played loud pop music incessantly, though I can't complain much since I never asked them to turn it off. We stayed four nights and were dreading breakfast by the third morning. The bed situation was "resolved" the next day by them pushing our two single beds together. In my initial contact email I had specifically asked not to have this, so I was a bit surprised. The gentleman at the front desk who I spoke to told me that this was the only solution as they didn't have any other rooms in our size with a double bed. He didn't seem to understand that the fact that they had promised me something different was a problem. He also pointed out that we couldn't tell the difference, which I found somewhat insulting since obviously we did feel the difference, falling into the crack between the two beds. He did not offer any discount or other compensation. One final note: the hotel owners seem to have an almost neurotic need to put their hotel logo on *everything* in the hotel... the shower door, towels, toiletries, hairdrier... you name it. The hotel has some character and a great location, but I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: kushjethwa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location in central madrid and close to the palace. Free buffet style breakfast although there is not a lot on offer and it is basic. The only problem I had with the hotel was on the first night reception had no activated my air conditioning. So for the first night I had a terrible nights sleep as I was feeling too hot. In the morning this was rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Capital City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kerriekhowe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a six night stay at the Meninas. We found it very good value for money for a capital city and were particularly impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the reception staff. In so many hotels this service is impersonal, but not at the Meninas. The location is excellent being in a quiet street close to the Opera House and Castle. Our room was good and well equipped with a very comfortable bed and pillows, so often lacking in more expensive hotels. The building is old and quirky and such a change from many of the more soulless 4* hotels. I would certainly recommend this hotel to visitors to Madrid and would stay here again if we returned to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: mtwojo
Reviews.Content: Madrid is an interesting town where all the key sights seemed clustered around each other one moment and spread out the next. The Meninas is between two metro stops; it is about 200 meters from the opera house; and it is 2-3 blocks from the palace. I am sure there are other hotels that are as nicely situated, but it hard to think of one that is better situated. On top of the location, the room was a deal, and the hotel was clean, modern, and it felt like it had been newly remodeled. The staff was great. They accommodated us when we arrived unexpectedly late, they helped us make some reservations at local restaurants, and they held our bags when we left for an overnight stay in Sevilla. They even offered a free breakfast with our room. The room itself was on a courtyard in the interior of building. Everything was painted a light shade of gray. Given the limited light from the interior courtyard, this made the room a little dark and uninviting, but in the grand scheme of things, it was a small detail in otherwise fine hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: OhadB
Reviews.Content: I got back from my vacation in Madrid (which took place between the 19th and the 24th June). Madrid is a lovely city and this hotel was the perfect place to stay and to explore it. As mentioned by the reviewers here, the room was very comfortable and well designed and the breakfast was excellent but what made this hotel very special for me was the amazing staff. I've been in several hotels before but have never encountered such a kind, polite, professional, and efficient staff which made my stay wonderful! The location of the hotel can't be better! Usually I try to avoid central places, since they tend to be extremely noisy at night, but exactly as all the other reviewers said, the hotel is located on a little side street so it's very quiet despite the fact that it's very close to the royal palace, to Plaza Mayor, to Puerta del Sol and to Gran Via. If you want to walk to Paseo del Prado, where Madrid's famous museums are located, just walk through San Jeronimo street from Puerta del Sol and you'll arrive at Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and at Neptune square (from which you can walk to Museo del Prado). By the way, if you're in San Jeronimo street, don't miss Casa Mira (in #30), best place to buy turrón http://www.gomadrid.com/shopping/Casa-Mira.html Well, back to the hotel :-) Thought I didn't use most of the services it offered (like free DVDs and books rental), I think those unique services really reflect the hospitality of this hotel and the willingness to do as much as possible to make our stay pleasant. I also found the map, the brochures and the booklets (with events and important addresses in Madrid), which I got when I arrived, very helpful. I also used the shuttle service from the hotel to the airport which I found very comfortable and efficient. If you plan to use this service (13 € per person) please allow one hour ride to the airport. I wish they offered a similar service from the airport to the hotel…. Please feel free to contact me if you have any question regarding this hotel or my stay in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “super boutique hôtel”
Reviews.Author: SidJain
Reviews.Content: it was this small gem of a hotel tucked away, 7-8 min walk from the main road. beautiful rooms, very nicely designed. great aesthetics. we didn't have meals there. location is the best of both worlds - peaceful yet central. we took a triple sharing room which was a junior suite, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveR002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from staying here for three nights. We chose the hotel on the strength of the Trip Advisor comments and I must say they are correct. The Hotel was very good indeed. The staff are friendly and helpful, the location is fantastic being close to the Palace, Opera, Plaza Mayor etc etc. My only comment would be, if you can, try and get a superior room, ours was a standard double, very clean and comfortable but also very small, dark with only a light well window. This is an observation not a complaint as the room all other respects was fine and we only were in for a short while because the City is such a great place to be in, who wants to stay in the Hotel. Internet is available in the lobby either on teh Hotel PC or wifi. The hotel printed our boarding cards for the return flight which was helpful. I would not hesitate to return here. Thank you for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Luluwc70
Reviews.Content: We loved this intimate little hotel. It was clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic, easy walking distance to the amazing Mercado San Miguel and Palacio Real.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great problem solvers”
Reviews.Author: ilre12345
Reviews.Content: I always judge a hotel by the way they handle a problem. My wife and I, with another couple, started our trip to Spain with a 3 day stay in a Junior Suite at the Hotel Meninas. We arrived around 11:00am and our room was ready which was great for us to wash up and begin to explore the city. The location of this hotel is very central. Rooms were comfortable and clean and the front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, the air conditioner was not working. We went out for the day and when we returned, the buiding engineer told us that he could not fix the unit but the service company would be in the next day. I spoke to the front desk and another junior suite was not available. He offered to give us another room for the night to sleep in. We were told that it was fine to leave our luggage in the first room and that the air conditioner would be fixed. The next day we went out again to explore the city, got back to the hotel to find a nice cool room. When I checked out, we were given a credit for the difference from the junior suite to the regular room. I thought the hotel handled this very well and this really didn't put a damper on the trip. The breakfast was very good. Only small issue I had was that wifi was only available on the first floor. Still and all, I found this to be an excelent choice for Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hotel Meninas, Spain”
Reviews.Author: Maremalan
Reviews.Content: We would like to thank Hotel Meninas for our unforgettable experience. Hotel Meninas has a wonderful old European feel with the benefits of modern fittings. The breakfast was delicious and the service was excellent! They accommodated us with a late check out and the use of a room before we had to go to the airport. Kind hospitality, advise, friendly service and answering of endless questions are only to mention a few of the great qualities we experienced at Hotel Meninas. The Wi-fi is the only small problem, as it only connects on the first floor and the lobby. We will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel. All the staff at Jeremie Malan Architects and Interiors, Pretoria, ZA.

Reviews.Title: “This is a marvelous hotel in the center of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Arleneraya
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Clean, inviting rooms. Friendly, and VERY helpful service. Very centrally located on a quiet street. Close to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kcoers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully situated within walking distance to everything...The Palace,The Opera,Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol,yet is on a wonderful little side street so you do not have the noise of traffic...the rooms are comfortable and elegant and breakfast is outstanding...and the staff? friendly,helpful and happy to offer suggestions for restaurants,excursions,etc...Hotel Meninas is now my favorite hotel in Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: AzitaHr
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband and daughter at Junior suite for five nights.The hotel is very nicely located and you can walk to nearly all places of interest.The Opera Metro station and also bus station is less than a minute walk. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and make you feel at home.Although it is an old building the rooms are modern and very chic decoration.Very clean. The buffet breakfast was nice too. The wifi was only available in the lobby.This is the only weak point of the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the Room (Jr. Suite-3 people)”
Reviews.Author: SusanEn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in one of the best locations you can find, by the Opera metro. We walked from there to Museo El Prado and enjoyed the walk through restaurants and shops. The hotel is a boutique hotel, really chic, modern, but still preserves the feel of an old Madrid Building. The hotel personnel were very nice and helpful in every aspect. I was traveling with my husband and mother so the Jr. Suite was perfect. I was worried thinking that the sofa bed would not be confortable but that was not the case because the sofa bed is not pull out is more like a daybed with a good matress. The size of the master bedroom was nice. I did not hear much noise from the 4th room. The breakfast was the best we had in any hotel, plenty of variety, good quality of food and well presented. I will definetely recommend. Me encantó y volveria otra vez.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a central location upscale and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: Robin N
Reviews.Content: Quiet side street makes this charming hotel even better. We have really enjoyed our stay! Close walk to Opera metro. Easy walk to Playa Mayor, Playa Sol and the Palace. I loved the modern decor. Staying in a Junior suite was the perfect amount of space for couple and 10 yr old child. Lovely buffet breakfast. Wished for coffee in our room so we would bring tray up from buffet. Not the norm, but made us happy and they were happy to accommodate. Disappointing that you could only get wifi in lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Krayto
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, food was good, staff was polite. If you're visiting Madrid, this is a great place to stay in. Lots of places to visit on walking distance. Shopping centers, places to eat, etc. Loved the location and the price for the stay was Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad753
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fantastic. The hotels is on a quiet street but close to many attractions. Very often we just walked, even to the Paseo de Prado museums and the Atocha Railway Station. The Opera metro station is very close, though. The rooms are small, clean and functional. The high ceilings should help to avoid claustrophobic feeling. Not much space for yoga lovers. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and offers many choices. The staff is helpful. Two laments: Internet connection in the rooms (cable) seems outdated. The metro line is close to the surface and one can hear (or feel) the rumble of the trains. It did not interfere with our sleep, though. Perhaps we were too tired after sightseeng and walking.

Reviews.Title: “A good start to two-week self-guided tour of Spain”
Reviews.Author: CamCurrie11
Reviews.Content: Flew into Madrid from U.S., took taxi to hotel. Arrived early and front-desk staff didn't bat an eyelash. Fluent English-speaking staff checked us in to upper-floor street room with itty, bitty French-doored balcony. Rooms small by typical boorish American standards, but we love the Europen standard and have no complaint. Room was clean and tidy and within walking distance to just about all sights in Madrid - including the San Gines chocolateria where, since 1894, you can get THE best hot chocolate and churros and eat on cobblestones throughout the night. The room's en suite bath was spotless and modern, and while we marvel at two twin beds pushed together to make a double, it was not uncomfortable. Easy-to-use in-room safe for electronic devices. Front desk hooked us up with subway directions (station is less than a block away) and cab rides. The nearby squares swell with masses of pedestrians, but we loved watching seniors strolling hand-in-hand and natives mixing wiith tourists, and think this a top spot. Hotel had best included-breakfast of our stay: wide variety, restocked often - proteins, carbs, coffee. One note of caution: trash collection is early and often. We swear they came up the road three times per night. Got used to it and slept through second and third nights, but if you're sensitive to noise, ask for room in rear. Pleasant wooded staircase with landings worth the walk up - check out exterior wall paintings!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachaeleddie
Reviews.Content: Great location about 2 mins walk from the palace and yet still quiet at night. The rooms are minimalistic and modern with wood floor which does feel very cold so take socks! We only stayed room only so never saw anyone, very quiet. It was a great location with the main street just around the corner, starbucks, restaurants all with in staggering distance.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: locatelli
Reviews.Content: We are dividing this review into two parts because we had two separate experiences. Part 1 - The Hotel. The hotel is a boutique hotel. Our room had a small balcony that looked out on to a Parisian type street. The bed was large and comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom had a large array of toiletries. There were a few little things that needed attention in the room. The bathroom door could not open and shut easily because the material it was made of had become wet at some stage and had swollen so badly it didn't swing properly and the toilet roll holder and toilet seat were both broken. It was generally quiet except for the rubbish trucks in the early hours each morning. It was in a very convenient location. We could easily walk to the Palacio area, the Plaza Mayor, one of the main shopping streets, Sol, art museums and many other tourist sites. When we wanted to venture further the metro was right at the end of the street. The staff were friendly and very helpful especially when one of us got food poisoning from their Opera Restaurant (not from the breakfast buffet). They all spoke English which was good for us because our Spanish is hopeless. The buffet breakfast was fantastic. The chef responsible for breakfast was excellent. She baked the bread, squeezed the fresh orange juice and added a lot of extra special touches. There was free wi-fi in the lounge. Part 2 - The Opera Restaurant We were arriving at Meninas after a 24 hour flight. When we read about the half-board option we thought we would do this so that we didn't have to worry about finding a place to eat each day. We were aware that many Spanish people have their main meal during the day but we asked for the dinner option because we figured if we were out for the day we could arrive back in the evening and enjoy dinner close to the hotel. This was our first mistake. The first evening the meal was OK but not great. On the second evening we were served a piece of pretty dry fried chicken and a heap of chips. That night one of us got very bad food poisoning which could only have been from the chicken. The next day the one of us that could still eat asked to change to lunch each day instead of dinner. After that we had a daily Menu del Dia which was very good. The other point about the restaurant is that the advertising on the website is slightly misleading. It appeared to us that each night when you dined there might be opera singing to listen to but this is in a separate dining room downstairs and is not part of the hotel deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cute rooms, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel122
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor of the rooms with pink accents. We got a basic room but was perfect in size for my husband and I. The room was clean with nice amenities. The bed however was horrible! I don't know if it was the side that I was on but my back hurt the whole night! The pillows did not help me either. My husband did not complain. We had the breakfast buffet which was delicious! I recommend the breakfast it has plenty of tasty food. The hotel is very close to the center of madrid, which made it easy to walk to many places. The staff is very friendly as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is thinking of going to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great location”
Reviews.Author: Chloe S
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the middle of Madrid. Our room was a comfortable and clean with great bathroom amenities and friendly staff. Would recommend to anyone travelling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: benFlys
Reviews.Content: Really quite a charming little place. Rooms were good sized (I shared a sort-of Jr. Suite with 2 friends), comfortable, clean, and attractively designed. Excellent location, close to transit, museums, tapas in La Latina, and pretty much everything you could want in central Madrid. I will say that the price was at the top end of what I would pay. Not terribly expensive, but I would not pay this much if I were covering the whole room myself. Front desk spoke perfect English and were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderGB
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore heart of Madrid by walk – including such gems as Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, Puerto del Sol, Gran Via etc. A minute walk from nearest subway station. Reception desk personal was kind and professional. Room was small but clean, linens were perfect. Bathroom well equipped. Hi-speed internet in room wired only. Hotel offered complementary gym, unfortunately inconveniently to use. Good refreshing would be strongly recommended, otherwise this is best price/value offer.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: klung
Reviews.Content: Excellente service. The front desk personnel are very friendly and the general manager is the best in Madrid. This is a true boutique hotel where you can experience a personalize service. I would highly recommend this hotel for vacations and business trips. The location is perfect and the rooms are very comfortable. Special THANKS to Andre who make out new year eve perfect and give us the special touch (champagne and grapes) for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: aeropostale
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit my needs perfectly. I just stayed for a few nights by myself and the area was safe and convenient. Almost around the corner from the royal palace! Also close to Mercado de San Miguel and the metro. Clean room and bathroom, with a modern design. Wi-fi only in the lobby. The shuttle to the airport was also well-priced and easy to book.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TGandDG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the Opera House. Easy walk to Plaza Mayor and many other sights, tapas bars and restaurants. We arrived way before check-in time and the room wasn't ready (or so the desk clerk said). Try back after 11. So, we left most of our bags and set out on foot - sleep deprived but enthusiastic. Had our first meal (breakfast) at a local restaurant across from the Opera House. We walked and looked around at the palace, a cathedral, the 'new market' & Plaza Mayor. Came back after 11. The room still was not available, or so the same clerk said. We were too tired to walk more so we settled into the lobby chairs. A few minutes later, a manager type encouraged the clerk to look harder. What do you know, there was a room. But, it was not what we reserved - 1 double bed. I went back to the desk where another clerk said that we could have a room like we requested but it wouldn't have outside view. We said OK. When we went to the second room it was what we requested and had the outside view. Go figure. The room was small but clean and comfortable and had everything that we needed. The products were nice and the bathroom was large enough. The beds were comfortable but the lighting was poor. The breakfast buffet was excellent and included another version of Tortillas Espanole, pastries, coffee, fruits, meats, eggs, etc. plus white and sparkling wines. The juices and yogurts left something to be desired. The young woman staffing the breakfast worked like a galley slave to keep things refreshed and appealing. The original front desk person was a zero who gave off the sense that he had no time of day for the American tourists. The room was quiet (except for trash pickup at 3AM on Monday? morning). The pickup was extra loud and extra long. Internet was available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: NYC_D12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Hotel Meninas in November 2011. This hotel provided great value with an excellent location. The hotel was a nicely kept boutique hotel. The included breakfast was incredible, my girlfriend and I were so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breakfast that was included in what we felt was a very reasonable rate per night. The room was well appointed although a bit tiny, it really was only big enough to fit a full size bed. The bathroom was new and updated, nicely appointed with granite or marble countertop, stand up shower. The location was incredible, we were walking distance to many attractions, La LAtina, the palace etc.. we did almost everything on foot and nothing seemed to be more than a 10 minute or so walk. All in all it was a lovely place in a great location. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Pris11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, a European boutique hotel without a doubt. The rooms, are very small you can barely fit two medium size suitcases. The window was above the bed, no view, and the room was dark, even with the window open. The room was clean, no carpets, and other than the size, it was ok. The location is excellent, walking distance to many restaurants and attractions, but on a side street which was conveint since it was quiet. The wifi at the lobby was free. The staff is friendly and very helpful; the breakfast is continental, with good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Overrated”
Reviews.Author: neversayneverFlorida
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and visiting the hotels website and looking at their photos, I was impressed. The perception is that this was a great boutique hotel in a great location. I am usually extremely reasonable with my reviews but this place is so overrated an here is why: The pictures that are shown on their website are very well done, because it doesn't look anything like them. As far as the room is concerned, it was an extreme disappointment. My boyfriend is 6'3" and I am 5'8" and both of our feet were dangling off the bed. The room was extremely small, with the bathroom positioned on the opposite side of the room, furthest from the front door. All in all, claustrophobic. Their was one window and it was above the bed and very small. I normally don't care for the rooms in Europe to be glamorous, because I don't spend much time in the rooms, but this was just very uncomfortable. Their are two positives with this hotel if you don't care about the room: location is excellent (but their are better hotels in the same location with the same price), and the breakfast is better than most. Negatives: the staff doesn't speak very well English to lend advice, internet connection is bad and with cable only in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, quiet & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NY C
Reviews.Content: Great location, near Opera Metro. Nice quite street. We stayed in a room overlooking the street and it was super quiet. Nice down pillows and comforters, our only hotel in Spain that had down. Small rooms but comfortable. Tub and shower, nice water pressure and very hot water. Large breakfast room in the basement. It is worth the extra charge to have breakfast here. It is a huge hot buffet with everything. Nice not to worry about breakfast when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Duder13
Reviews.Content: Why Meninas? Basically I looked around on TA and online and gave up on a really nice and cool luxury hotel in town....with a spa and the works....they all kinda had these weak offers or cost north of 500EUR p night....and still amenities that weren't our style- I mean for that price we wanted indoor/outdoor pool etc....none of that in MAD which is fine... So we went boutique in the heart of town....not too many tourists walking around which is important for us....Junior suite for four nights....the plan discover the town and the food. LOVED the location....You are right there- Metro, cabs, bus or better yet, walk...all the main sites and monuments also....Starbucks close too....basically you're covered. Service at the reception was very pleasant and helpful. Downsides- Yeah it's a bit odd that they don't have WIFI in the rooms, but my guess is that this is a seriously old building that was renovated and you just can't drop Access Points that easily- not without irradiating the whole building....so we went downstairs or connected with the cable in the room. Totally loved the 'old' feel of the building- they tried to keep some of that which is great- but for the sticklers they could work on keeping the details- paint, water marks, stains...but that wasn't our priority. What kinda irritated us with a Junior Suite was the whole 'two bed' thing- I was like huh? Queenbed is not a luxury option!!! TV's are a bit small for a suite....and connected through a slightly obscure cable box....but with a little effort we figured it out- didn't come to MAD to watch TV or movies....so whatever...location made up for it. Breakfast (till 11) was pretty good- nothing to blow your mind...but enough to fire you put to go charging into town for sightseeing and having lunch at 4...a special nod to the fresh squeezed OJ. Espresso is extra...but it's there. Bathroom for the suite was good but the amenities where a bit odd- who needs a shoe shine kit- how bout q-tips and moisturizer? We noted this and I'd be willing to bet that they will make the necessary changes. Plus they were filling it all up daily....no nickel and dining on the soap/shampoo....which I like. Apparently you can also use the gym at the Opera hotel next door- but I didn't bother (sounded like a really small gym) - there are a couple of good gyms available for 25Euros if you're keen to get a workout. So all in all it was a good stay- I liked the people, I didn't feel like I was in some major 'wannabe' hotel...(we dropped by the Westin for a sniff and frankly the word 'lame' just screamed in our minds... 'Hi I think I'm 5 star but the details and the crowd is 3 star'....and the tourists....yeah....thanks but no thanks. Meninas has a great location and it was clean and they were paying attention to us...yeah I have my bones to pick- but hey...welcome to international travel- unless you want to drop a G per night....dont expect to have your mind blown on every detail. I'd go back to Meninas. As for the food- make sure you do some research- lots of great stuff- but on average the TA recommendations sucked! Stick with some guides and discover great joints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Men-rui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, it is located right across the street from the Opera train station and within easy walking distance from all of the main tourist attractions in Madrid. The area was simply perfect for touring the city and was close to lots of nice restaurants and bars. The hotel states that it has a restaurant but the ground floor of the hotel is tiny and the onyl area I could see was a tiny dining area at the back of the lobby which looked like someones dining room. The thing that makes this place is the staff, they were always smiling and greeted us on our return to the hotel. I had a bit of a medical emergency over there and had to get medicine shipped via DHL from home on the day of check out and the staff took my number and told me they would call when the delivery arrived. There is a computer free to use with wireless internet in the lobby which was really handy for us in finding restaurants and bars in the area. The staff speak wonderful English and are very obliging when looking for specific events or good places to see or eat in close by. The hotel is lovely and small and nicely decorated and has a very cool, botique feel. The room itself was perfectly clean and always spotless on our return and toiletries were refreshed each day. These were also a little bit better quality than standard hotels I have been to before. My onyl gripe is the room is tiny, our suitcases had to be hidden in the wardrobe to have enough room to run around and it is also very dark with very little natural light. The view from our room was into some weird alley that seems to run down the centre of the hotel (not very pleaseing to the eye). For this reason they covered the windows with curtains which kept out any light. The hotel also has wooden floors and you can hear EVERYTHING. My God the maids made some amount of noise in the mornings and we could hear them banging hoovers and wardrobes. This woke us every morning of our 3 night stay. Overall location and staff made this a perfect hotel for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: 42man
Reviews.Content: Situated literally 30 seconds from the Opera house and 2 minutes walk from the main shopping areas of central Madrid, this is a very nice boutique style of hotel in a small and quiet backstreet in Madrid. The staff are excellent, they are cheerful extremely helpful and obliging.... The single room I stayed in was quite small but the bed was very comfortable, very nicely decorated. My only slight personal gripes are that the air conditioning is set to not go any lower than 22 degrees (and I like sleeping in a cooler room). In this instance I had to open the big window in the room every night (which opens out onto a small space where other hotel rooms overlook as well as the stair windows) and on one occasion I was woken (about 5:30-6:30am) by a cleaner banging around on the stairs...... The shower floor is quite steep and you can slip if you aren't really careful.... Although the wi fi is completely free - (YES a hotel whose Wi Fi IS ACTUALLY FREE) (24 hour password access) the connection is very weak and on 2 occasions returning to the hotel during the day, I couldn't get any connection at all....the hotel does have a stand alone PC in the reception area but it has a Spanish keyboard, and can get busy.... Breakfast is an amazing affair that you won't be disappointed with, however on the second morning of my stay and arriving at 7:35am all there was in the 'hot' section was bacon and nothing else... no eggs or sausage....

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: SS905
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a trip with friends where the focus was on doing a lot of exploring. If you are the type of person that loves to walk around and keep busy during the day, and needs a nice, quality room to spend the night in, then this hotel is for you. Rooms and bathrooms are clean, polished, and comfortable. Slightly small, but, again, not meant to be dwelled in like you would at a luxury hotel. Beds are firm (which I like and apparently is the standard for Spain) and we had two pillows per person. The location is absolutely phenomenal. On a quite side street with the Opera and Santo Domingo metro stops only minutes away, and other central areas like the Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and Gran Via very walkable (10-20 mins). In the nearby plaza surrounding the Opera metro stop, there’s a pharmacy (quite useful for my boyfriend who was battling a cold) and an Open-25 store (24-hour convenience store to pick up snacks, drinks, candy, and various products). And a few great restaurants like Vadebaco (directly across the street from the hotel) and the Café El Opera (around the corner) were particularly closeby. Reception was nice, but we did most of our research beforehand on where to eat and what to do, so we only utilized them for basic questions (where is the closest pharmacy, etc). One reception girl in particular was really sweet when I was trying to find a nail salon (alas, Madrid lacks the plethora of nail salons like New York). I was lucky to have thoroughly read reviews, and I love a good night's sleep, so I requested a room facing the inside of the hotel in advance. I had no problems with outside noise, like some of the other guests who had street-facing rooms. I was also relieved that I opted out of the hotels that were directly on the Gran Via or other busy intersections which might have been equally central but were probably extra busy/noisy (especially Thursday to Saturday). At one point I was deciding between Hotel Meninas and Hotel Opera, which I later learned are sister properties and around the corner from one another. We wound up staying at both hotels on separate legs of our trip, and I think Hotel Opera has the slight edge for having wifi readily accessible in the hotel rooms. Unfortunately, at Hotel Meninas, the wifi was only available in the hotel lobby (not sure if this is a permanent thing), but if you had a cable-ready device (laptop) the hotel would loan out a wifi wire to use in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located !”
Reviews.Author: harrybBunbury
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel in the Opera area, We felt it was value for money. The central city noise was not an issue for us and we had a street facing room. Breakfast was excellent, wifi only in lobby area. Would we stay again, yes .

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to rate it excellent, but....”
Reviews.Author: Elisabm
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel after doing a long research on TA reviews about many hotels. The reasons why I chose this hotel were all met: location, price and charm. The location is perfect: within a short (very short) walking distance to the royal palace, plaza mayor, gran via, puerta del sol and the subway station in less than 200 mts away from the hotel door. My husband and I pretty much enjoy walking around and twice we walked from Paseo Del Prado to the hotel. Taking the Gran Via it is a 30 minute walk or so... We booked through the internet and got a fair deal for Madrid standarts. Of course you may find cheaper alternatives, but we wanted a big room, a big bathroom (with a nice shower) and a well located hotel. As we booked through the internet we got breakfast included in our daily rate. Otherwise we would have to pay E15 per person. We found breakfast to be very tasteful with a variety of juices, pastries, fruits, local foods (e.g. tortilla) and even wine for those who wanted to. If we had to pay E15 per person for breakfast, then I think I would eat somewhere else... The hotel is charming and we loved the decor in our room. Staff was really helpful and booked our shuttle to the airport (which I recommend). Why didn't I rate it excellent? Well, for two reasons: first, the internet in the rooms is cabled. Wi fi only in the lobby. And the internet connection is very, very slow. Sometimes we struggled for minutes to access a website or to download pictures. That was annoying! Please provide fast and wi fi in the room ASAP!!! Second, the street where the hotel is located seems to be a quiet street. Big mistake. At least during our stay... We could hear people talking in the street until (at least) 11:30 p.m. We had to sleep with our window open since air conditioning stopped working at the third day... Finnaly, the worst of all happened twice during our stay. I presume it happened during the days that glass was being collected from the trash. The noise was so loud that I could not get back to sleep... And it lasted for a few minutes. At 3:30 a.m! If that is routine, I think the hotel should provide the front rooms with a sort of anti-noise window.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite the Quality that I expected”
Reviews.Author: MaddyL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at las Meninas for 3 nights at the beginning of October. I agree with the other reviews that the hotel is well situated - near the Opera and the Royal Palace. Our room however was exceedingly cramped, dark and the furnishings were average. We were travelling with another couple - none of us could figure out how the televisions in the rooms worked!The bathroom was of an appropriate size and well-appointed. The housekeeping was good. Breakfast is served in a series of small rooms in the basement. The offerings were reasonable. The front desk staff, while not exactly rude, were quite indifferent. The level of knowledge and service at the desk was poor. The female staff member on the desk in the early evening had no knowledge of local restaurants, neither could she give any suggestions. This was particularly disappointing as many restaurants are closed Sunday evening throughout Madrid and we had a challenge discovering what was open for business. I would recommend the Orient Cafe on the square, west of the Opera house - it offered the best service and food of the local restaurants we tried. I would consider this hotel a 3 star. It was not up to the 4 star level of hotels we experienced in Barcelona and elsewhere on our travels in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: Gazzali M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights recently. Enjoyed our stay very much. The location was perfect and was easy walking distance to many of the attractions in this city. The room was comfortable and the bathroom modern. The absence of a hospitality tray was compensated by the willingness of the staff to bring a hot drink to the room when ever we needed one. Breakfast was a fair spread. What impressed us most was the staff, all of whom were friendly and helpful and always went the extra mile. Neither my wife nor I speak Spanish and hence to find that we could communicate with the staff in English was so convenient. We would go back to this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: Seanagh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real little gem. Very central, close to where all the action is in Madrid and only a short walk to the Opera metro. We initially stayed for 5 nights and our room was just lovely. Bed was comfortable and room very modern and clean with a large bathroom. Breakfast was included in the tarif and the buffet breakfast was the best I have come across in all of my travels. Staff all spoke good english and they bent over backwards to get anything we needed or assist us with information. We returned to Madrid a second time and arranged to stay there again - and we were not disappointed. Very good value for money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hargar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Friendly staff. Great location. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zim528
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, good size, comfortable. Included breakfast was excellent. Staff helpful. Location great - a block from the Opera metro station and a short walk to the Plaza de Espana metro. Very close to Palacio Real and a reasonable walk to the Prado. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights during September, and found the location to be perfect and the staff really helpful and friendly. The location was easy to find, yet tucked far enough away from the usual hustle and bustle - we did experience some street noise in the early hours of our first night, however the following night we heard nothing - this is to be expected when staying in the middle of the city that's been described as one that 'simply doesn't sleep'! The hotel is lacking a little in natural light (this is to be expected when located in a small street), however this didn't bother us as we were barely in the hotel during the daytime. We did experience a drain type odor in our room in the afternoons, however the air-con helped to eradicate this instantly. The room we stayed in was a great size and provided us with everything we needed, however it was looking a little sparse on the decorating front. Our room was facing the street, on the fifth floor and in the eaves of the hotel, so our view was slightly obscured. Breakfast was included in our booking and it was lovely - both hot and cold, ranging from jamon, eggs, cereals and fruit, and to finish a selection of delicious cakes! We told the hotel it was our wedding anniversary before hand, and when we reached our room we were delighted to find a bottle of Cava sitting on ice awaiting our return - a really lovely touch! It's always fascinating to stay at a hotel which has been well described/reviewed - I'm not sure any of what I read gave me a true feel for this hotel. So, in as few words as I can use, I'd describe it as a charming, small hotel offering great value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hobokendippy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights - location is great -- walking distance to all the fun stuff and on a side street so it doesn't get too loud at night. Pretty fast Internet in rooms, modern bathrooms, stacked minibar

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pilastri10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at end August. Picked it after reading reviews on TA and was not disappointed. First of all, the location was perfect: turn right and you're in Plaza Opera (Metro stop). Take Calle Arenal and you end up at the Plaza del Sol. If you go the other way you're already at Palacio Real. The center of Madrid is quite small so you can walk practically anywhere. Getting back to the hotel, we had spacious double room with balcony on Campomanes (very quiet even if on main street). Breakfast is served until 11am, in fact hardly anyone was there at 8.30! The choice was endless: fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, eggs and bacon, cold cuts, muffins, donuts, cakes, croissants, fresh orange and other juices, hot coffee, tea and milk. We had a special rate with breakfast included and 4 nights for the price of three. I would recommend asking for a room with balcony (n.303) because there are other smaller and darker rooms on the courtyard which aren't as nice. The hotel maids were like little elves (cleaning while we were out) keeping the room spotless and always replenishing the bath amenities. The young staff was very professional always eager to lend a hand. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: aimerouge
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in September 2011 and had a very good experience. The hotel is in a wonderful location which puts you within walking distance of two metro locations; two tour bus stops; the Opera House and Palace; Plazas Mayor and Sol; two excellent places to watch Flamenco; and a lovely Plaza steps from the hotel entrance so you can relax and watch the world go by. The hotel is also off the main street so it's quaint and quiet. If breakfast can be included in your stay, I recommend it. The staff was courteous and friendly. The room is small by American standards, but even with a inside room I found it comfortable by European standards. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chester T
Reviews.Content: We were planning to go to Rome but our flight were cancelled due to their General Strike 6 Sept. Found this hotel on a last minute special - 92 Euros for a very quiet large room (facing internal air well). Location is perfect - around the corner from Opera and easy stroll to Royal Palace and other attractions. I felt perfectly safe strolling around the hotel at night. Solid free wired internet and friendly staff plus great breakfast made our stay great. However, I don't understand the 4-star rating. This is the first time I encountered a 4 star property with no porter service and just a packet of 5 small tissues in the bathroom. Not a big deal but a little surprise to someone accustomed to the 4 star standards in Asia/Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless, Unique Stay in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PathologicalTravelr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of Madrid just steps from Plaza Isabel and the Theater. Very easy subway access as well as a taxi station to take you wherever you wanted to go or you can walk to the Royal Palace and Cathedral in 8 minutes. The staff was very accommodating with impeccable service. The building maintains its historical facade and in room details with all the modern conveniences and renovations to make it a comfortable luxury hotel. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “An Opera Gem”
Reviews.Author: RachieDoo
Reviews.Content: A friend and I checked in last week (Room 104) and were pleasantly surprised. The staff was beyond helpful and gracious. The room was beautiful (living room with terrace) bedroom (with two terraces) a spacious closet and a modern bathroom with double sinks. The hotel is very charming with modern amenities and includes a buffet style breakfast, which was very good. The location is also perfect -- walking distance to all the action and sites. I definitely recommend this boutique hotel and will return without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: amanda11705
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in Madrid at the Hotel Meninas and really enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a double room, which was small, but clean and modern. The hotel staff was very helpful and you can borrow dvd's for free to watch in your room. We were tired of CNBC and found this a nice way to relax before bed. The hotel is in a great location, just a block from the opera metro and walking distance to plaza mayor. Recommend getting the breakfast at the hotel, it was a decent spread and good value.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay, there will be a 3rd, 4th, ....”
Reviews.Author: seriouslymaybe
Reviews.Content: I first stayed here in summer of 2010, the weekend Spain won the soccer world cup and found the location and amphiance fantastic, so decided to come back this summer, and I am glad I did. My husband, daughter and I stayed in an interior room with windows to the inner courtyard instead of to the street. The room was quiet, the beds very comfortable and the included continental breakfast was great. The location is excellent, with the Opera station down the street. On both occassions the staff has been very helpful, friendly and professional. My husband left his iPad in the dining room, and after we had already checked out, they contacted us to let us know they had it. We hadn't evern realized he had left it there. This is a great little gem that is economical, perfectly located, well staffed and a perfect place to rest after touring this great city. Will definately come back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever been”
Reviews.Author: Juliana_SP1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best and top value that we've ever been. Staff is extremely helpful and kind. We told them that we're going to leave too early to the airport so we wouldn't have time to have the breakfest in the hotel. They prepared a picnic kit for us, then at 6am we had something to eat before arriving at the airport, at no additional cost. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Location is perfect, just 1 block from the subway, and right in the touristic centre. You can do everything by walking. In Cava Alta, which is close to the hotel, we could eat nice tapas. Thanks for everything, Las Meninas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice”
Reviews.Author: not404
Reviews.Content: Meninas Hotel is a lovely boutique hotel in Madrid. It is located about halfway up a quiet street in the old section of Madrid. The hotel is quite pleasant where we stayed as a family of four quite comfortably in a top floor studio like room with one king bed and a rollaway couch which converted to two beds easily. Our room was spacious but I did take a look at the room map and realized that we lucked into one of the better rooms. The staff was pleasant and helpful and spoke English fluently. They pointed us to a number of local restaurants all of which were reasonable and quite good. Its location is excellent for a Madrid visit. It is a short walk to Plaza Meyor and three major metro stops including Puerta Del Sol. Also very close by is a major shopping area. All the major attractions are one or two Metro stops away. And if you don't want to do the Metro a major taxi stop is just down the street at the entrance to the Opera Metro stop. The Latin quarter which bodes a number of good restaurants and shops is just a short walk beyond the Plaza. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby. The breakfast was not in included in our package and we found it marginal and somewhat expensive but convenient. However the Starbucks is just two blocks away! All in all we found the Meninas an excellent choice for a four-day Madrid stop and would definitely return if our travels bring us back to the city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cafoodie2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the location, photos and reviews. What none of my research revealed is that this hotel is not very close to good restaurants and tapas. The hotel was nice enough, clean, quiet and the front desk pleasant. The rooms were comfortable, if small, and clean. The front desk spoke adamantly of the restaurant around the corner as having fantastic paella. We were skeptical, as it looked touristy - trying not to judge a book and all that. Well it was horrible. We were sad to report back to the hotel. The photos look nicer than the hotel, but it is clean and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May 2011 for 2 nights. The location is very good just near the Opera and a metro stop. The hotel staff were very pleasant and the room was nice and clean with air conditioning. We found a good deal on a olotels for 234euros including breakfast. Not cheap cheap but Madrid seemed to be on the more expensive side for hotels in general. Breakfast was a buffet and had a good range of hot and cold food. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Just a few maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: Columbia_ScMimi
Reviews.Content: Las Meninas is a wonderful boutique Hotel located just next to the Opera area and metro. The hotel staff were friendly during our stay and we found the breakfast sufficient and enjoyable...good enough to get the day started. We had a quadruple junior suite special which offered enough room for a family of four. The bathroom had a double sink and a separate toilet area...but the sliding door to the toilet area would get jammed and made a horrible squealing noise when you tried to lift and slide it open or closed. The shower was ok, and often the water temp would fluctuate between hot and cold so that was a pain. Again, these are issues that just require some maintenance attention. The beds were very comfortable and room was clean. There is a slight smell to a few of the rooms as noted in other reviews. We had to switch our first room out due to this dense smell which seemed to be possibly sewer related, not sure though. They did switch out the room for us without an issue. The location was unbeatable with the palace literally steps away as well as other tourist attractions. We roamed all of Madrid and in the end were delighted with the location of this hotel as our home base. One should pack earplugs just in case as it occasionally gets noisy outside, but not every night.

Reviews.Title: “definitely stay there”
Reviews.Author: Desert01
Reviews.Content: Great location, centrally located, close to metro, nice rooms, good breakfast. Reasonably priced. I would defintely stay there again. About 2 short blocks away, down a side street, is one of those buffets with lots of salad choices, pizza. When you need something green definitely go there.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: aeroplane186338
Reviews.Content: we had a three night break at the meninas,very comfy stay and so close to all amenities,breakfast brilliant plenty of choices the staff were very friendly and helpful ,really good value for money,in a quiet location,many thanks we had a lovely 3 day stay with you,we will definatley be backj,D hill Somerset

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: aalgermissen
Reviews.Content: What a great place. The hotel is steps from the metro, and close to the Plaza Mayor. The room was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was fantastic-I wish I could have stayed longer but had to meet my group. Definitely I would come back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: willandmeg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel and it was easily the best of the hotels that we stay at during our three weeks in Spain. It was very convenient to many sites and the metro (Opera station). The breakfast buffet was the best of all of hotels that we stayed in. The staff was very helpful in recommending travel arrangements, and clearing up problems with the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: marydell
Reviews.Content: A small group of family members and friends stayed here for several days in June. This small hotel is perfect! It is located on a quiet street in the old section of town on a major Metro stop (Opera) and within an easy walk of the Plaza Mayor, Plaza del Sol and other major sites. The staff is helpful and personable. The only negative is that the twin rooms are small (European style). I would recommend the junior suites if you want more space. The breakfast was the best that we had on our three week trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: megthomson
Reviews.Content: The Meninas is a wonderful little boutique hotel. My room was incredibly small, but had a comfortable bed and cute decor. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: ladmiral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meninas for three nights at the beginning of our travels through Spain, and ended there as well, for two more nights. Both visits were a delight. The hotel is very conveniently located very close by the Opera metro stop. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfast buffet was the best we found on our trip. Both the rooms we had (502 and 405) were very clean and a good size, with plenty of space in the bathroom as well. We did not have any issues with noise at this hotel. We found both rooms quiet and peaceful, with comfortable a/c. The hotel location is wonderful = very close to many great sights, including the Plaza Mayor, Mercado, and Royal Palace. All other sights were easy to access by metro. Would highly recommend and will visit again if in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely use the Meninas again”
Reviews.Author: Peter9069
Reviews.Content: Very convenient - 100mtrs from Opera, 200 from Palcio Real. Immaculate rooms. Staff very friendly and helpful. Excellent buffet breakfast served in restaurant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_mike_lin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a regular room for 2 persons with one bed. The room is quite small, and the bed is a bit narrow for 2 persons. However, the hotel makes up for it for being very central and close to the Opera metro station. It is also in a quiet location. The air conditioning unit in the room is surprisingly quiet as well. Our booking came with complimentary buffet breakfast. It was very good with a lot of selections. However, some of the fruits served were going bad. A major issue is the internet connection. It was very sporadic, the connection often cuts off.

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel, centrally located, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CardiganJones
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself has a quirky, stylish feel, but the single room I booked was uncomfortably small. Due to a change in circumstance, I needed a double room but the hotel was full. A staff member called their sister hotel, The Hotel Opera, which is just around the corner and arranged a double at no extra cost. To my mind, the test of a good hotel is whether they are prepared to be flexible in solving your travel dilemmas. This hotel did that and I am grateful to them for the assistance. Caveat: The hotel offers Wi-Fi but only in the lobby. There is an Ethernet Internet connection in the rooms; i.e. NO connection for Mac users.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star choice - great location, service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bonpups
Reviews.Content: A beautiful boutique hotel with reasonable price. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from the Opera metro stop in the city center area. The little plaza by the hotel is very lovely - lots of shopping and great for people watching. The hotel itself is very new and tastefully decorated. The rooms are not huge, but sufficient. I LOVE their buffet breakfast - lots of variety, a decent warm item selection and lovely cakes. The only wish I have is I wish they have Wifi in the room. Free Wifi is available in the lobby. Will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Worst nightmare”
Reviews.Author: atravelergal
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Madrid after a long day/night of traveling only to find that the hotel had canceled our reservation- they sent an email at 6pm the night before (while we were traveling to Spain). The front desk people we exceptionally rude about the cancelation (I had previously confirmed the reservation- twice). A group was staying at the hotel and their flight was canceled so their reservation was extended and ours was canceled. I am a flexible traveler and understand when things/plans change but this was really above and beyond. The hotel was very unhelpful with finding us another comparable hotel- we ended up staying at a small/dirty hotel on the other side of town. The service and treatment was extremely disappointing. Save yourself the aggravation and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “HOLA in BEAUTIFUL BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Pertasia
Reviews.Content: This review is a year late. Before our stay, I had a lot of correspondence with the hotel staff as I asked many questions from Flamenco to shopping ... and everyone who responded to my mails did so with professionalism and friendliness. I specially mention Enrique Rocafort's impeccable 5-star service! During our stay, all the staff were wonderful at different times of day or night, bringing a whole new meaning to the simple greeting -- HOLA! The hotel is small and modern and classy and clean with very nice lobby areas. I attach some photos including one in the breakfast room with delicious cakes and our lady server's welcoming smile. I shall definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bxlcpl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends and so we got the room with 4 beds so we could all be together. We were a little disappointed at first because the room was much smaller than we expected and one of the beds was one that pulled out from the bottom of another single bed... which apparently wasn't very comfortable. However when we enquired about the room, the hotel did give us a discount as it wasn't the room we had originally booked. That is the only negative thing I have to say. The hotel was situated in a perfect location. The rooms were clean, the regular beds were very comfortable, the breakfast was very good, and in general the staff were very friendly. We checked out a little later than we were supposed to and they were very nice about it when they reminded us about the check out time. I would definitely recommend the hotel and found it to be very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjspiegel
Reviews.Content: Just stay at the Hotel Meninas for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located we walked to everything. The staff at the Hotel were wonderful, the Hotel was very nice . We booked a double mini room. When they say mini they mean it there was know room for our lugguage. But the hotel has much nicer larger rooms ,which we will stay in the next time we are in Madrid. The breakfast was good. Again you could not ask for a better hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location but no hospitality”
Reviews.Author: millieg2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quiet side street in a great spot. You are in walking distance from pretty much everything – 5 minutes from the palace and about 15-20 minutes from the Retiro Park. The hotel itself was nicely decorated for a boutique hotel. The room was an interior room. The room itself was really small. There was only enough space for the double bed and unnecessary desk. The bathroom was also small. The shower was a standing shower and was very tight. The room size is fine if you don’t plan on taking large suitcases. Aside from the small room, there was a strong, horrible smell when I walked into the room and figured it would go away once I open the window. When I came back from sightseeing a few hours later, the smell had actually gotten a lot worse. I informed the front desk that there was a sewage who called maintenance to try and fix it. When they realized how bad the situation was, they moved me into a room facing the street, which was the only other room available in the hotel. While they did provide a new room, I was disappointed in their hospitality. Forget being offered a discount, they never even extended an apology for my inconvenience while dealing with this or at checkout. Overall, the appearance of the hotel is nice and the location is great, but when there is a problem, there is no real basic hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Meninas-Tranquil luxury in the madness of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: NightclubPeople
Reviews.Content: Hotel Meninas-Tranquil luxury in the madness of Madrid! 3 nights staying in the Hotel Meninas as a treat for my wife’s birthday could not have been better thanks to the fabulous Hotel Meninas and the TRULY WONDERFUL STAFF! After booking on-line through the hotels own website I contacted the team by e-mail to ask for restaurant recommendations for our first evening, my wife’s birthday. An email come directly back to me within minutes with several recommendations for our stay and also information on a booking which had been made on our behalf at an excellent typical Spanish restaurant in the heart of La Latina. The recommendation was superb and the evening a great success! The stylish hotel is in an un-beatable location in the centre of Madrid tucked along a small, quiet side street just off Plaza Isabel and Plaza Oriente and close to Opera metro station. Everything is within walking distance and the hotel is perfectly located to enable you to enjoy Madrid on foot. In a city like Madrid location is all-important for us and we were able to explore the various barrios in the morning, enjoy local tapas for lunch and walk back to the hotel for our siesta before venturing out again in the evening….perfect! On arrival at the hotel we were treated like old friends and quickly shown to a clam, tranquil room decorated in neutral colours and equipped with a fabulous bathroom, excellent lighting, safe, minibar etc. We didn’t need the minibar as a bottle of ice cold cava was delivered to our room within moments of arriving with complements of the hotel in celebration of my wife’s special day, a lovely touch. All the staff have an eye for detail and were eager to assist in every way possible going above and beyond to make our stay pleasurable. Our room rate included a buffet breakfast, which was superb, and the hotel had all the facilities you would ever need including a small restaurant, lounge area, meeting room, computer with Internet access etc. A beautiful, calm, tranquil hotel in a perfect location with outstanding staff. THANK YOU Luis, Enrique and the team for making our stay so very special.

Reviews.Title: “a smart hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tamworth7
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and it didn't disappoint. It's a boutique hotel tucked away on a quiet (by Madrid standards!) side street situated just behind the Opera House and 5 minutes walk from the Royal Palace and gardens. In fact it's central location means that you can reach all the major attractions and areas in Central Madrid on foot, which is the best way to get to see the city. Madrid comes alive at night and the buzz continues well into the early hours and without doubt the best feature of this hotel is that it's very quiet. We had an interior room, a must if you want to get any sleep. Don't be put off that the windows of an interior room won't offer a view; any rooms that face the street won't keep out the endless street/nightlife noise. Our room was a twin but the beds were pushed together and the room itself was quite small and basic, and everything seemed squeezed in, particularly as it had an unnecessarily large desk taking up so much space. If you are willing to pay about £50.00 more a night you can get a bigger superior room but to be honest it's not worth it for the amount of time you're likely to spend at the hotel. Despite the room size it was clean, modern and the bathroom immaculate. The staircase and general decor are really lovely. Breakfast isn't included and we chose not to have it as it was €15.00 each, way overpriced considering what you can have for a lot less in any of the numerous cafes situated just around the corner. The reception staff are courteous but I was a little disappointed that they didn't acknowledge my birthday; even a card from the hotel or any other small gesture would have shown a more personal touch. Never mind! In summary this hotel is clean, quiet and really well positioned, and I would recommend it for a long weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent service - wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: CTheuring
Reviews.Content: We were for a small business meeting at Hotel Meninas: Very good service at the hotel, very nice and happy staff - which tries to solve any problem and fulfill any wish. The location of the hotel close to the opera is perfectly situated to enjoy Madrid in the meeting breaks. Hotel rooms are nicely designed and very comfortable.
