The breakfast and coffee break servings were of high quality! Overall a very good place for our meeting!

Reviews.Title: “upate to prior review re: billing problem”
Reviews.Author: klsalas
Reviews.Content: I previously wrote a 1* review about my October 2010 stay at Meninas citing a billing hassle and added that as things stood at the time I could not recommend the hotel. However I have to say that Hotel Meninas worked very closely with us to resolve the overbilling and I found their efforts to be significant and sincere. Currently we cannot apparently delete or edit a prior review on Trip Advisor. However in view of the efforts of the hotel to make us whole again I owe them an updated, balanced review. I accept management's explanation and apologies. I will undoubtedly return to Madrid (a city I really love) in the future and I would certainly consider staying at Hotel Meninas again. As I hope I conveyed even in my last review our stay itself at Meninas had actually been quite nice with the exception of the billing problems at check out. We love Madrid and I found the location, style and room design of Meninas to be close to ideal. Their breakfast was also very generous and the room and hotel in general were well maintained and clean. I also found the service overall to be very good with the exception of the problems at check out, which I believe now were likely anomalous and caused by temporary circumstances. The location of the hotel is also exceptional with great shopping, restaurants, bars and sights nearby and easy public transportation connections. I especially enjoyed the proximity to C. Cava Baja and C.Nuncio -- our favorite Madrid tapas crawl. In terms of sleep quality, there was no bother at all from adjoining rooms -- a substantial issue for me. However one night/early morning there was very very loud banging outside on the street from what I believe was garbage collection. In fairness I should point out that our room had fairly well-insulated windows by the standards of other hotels in which we have stayed and as I recall there were shutters and they accomodated my preference for a reasonably high floor location as I recall. They really could have done little more to insure our maximum comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Churchie11
Reviews.Content: Good location, which is walking distance from major sights in Madrid, and also very close to the Metro station Opera. Room was a generous size with pretty French doors/shutters and a small balcony overlooking the road. If you don't appreciate street noise you may want to avoid the street facing rooms- but the shutters virtually eliminated the noise. Staff were friendly, breakfast was good. Free wifi is available, but only in the lobby, and not in rooms. Overall a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “A nice start to our vacation to Spain!”
Reviews.Author: frysix
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here; the room size didn't bother us because we weren't there a great deal. It was quiet & comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious! The hotel itself was attractive inside and out, and all the gentlemen at the front desk were very hospitable and attentive to our requests for ice, themostat adjustments, etc. We were "electronically challenged" in our room with regard to using our computer and charging things...the only slight disappointment was the shared exercise facility was not at the hotel. Though it had a rooftop view, it was very limited on machines, and the treadmill wasn't even working. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “4* interiors, but 2* comfort, avoid going in winter, book junior suite”
Reviews.Author: AppreciateCharm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is saved by its good looks! the interiors of rooms and communal areas are done with flair by an artist and are spotless, and on arrival it looks like a 4+ star small hotel. But it all changes once you try to relax in your room! Two options you have are: a tiny room facing the small dark-ish internal courtyard, these have NO central heating but just hot air conditioning which makes the small room stuffy very quickly, but without it you freeze there - plus there is no heating of ANY kind in the bathroom, not even a towel rail - it' s literally like a fridge! Oh, and small windows right above your bed! Second option, bigger rooms facing the street, which is better as the rooms are light and reasonable size - but you get a lot of noise as decribed here from garbage cars - it lasts for AGES and also there is construction going on near Opera. No bathrobes. The breakfast is good but nothing exceptional, staff mostly good, and location convenient. If you don't mind bad quality sleep, or go when no hetaing is needed, than it may be a good opton - or at least book junior suite as the rooms are really tiny - ok for one but only just! Beds are very comfy to be fair.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms, very nice service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: BhellFibla
Reviews.Content: This is a new boutique hotel near the Royal Palace area; in Madrid everything is quite close, so you go to the Plaza Mayor, Parque Del Retiro and Museo del Prado walking (is a long walk, but Madrid it's a perfect place for it). The hotel is very clean; the rooms are kind of small, but the breakfast is AMAZING! The area around the hotel is very safe, so you can go out at night with no worries at all. The staff is also very kind; I had to solve some work issues and they help me all the way, including sending the document back to Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, price, location, but small room”
Reviews.Author: groovyb
Reviews.Content: The location is steps from the Opera Metro stop. About a 5 minute walk to the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor. Our room was a little small, but we had 2 full size suitcases and made due. The room was clean. There was a free buffet breakfast and free wifi. Our room was quiet as we were facing the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Time to man up: Heat, TV, room size, airport shuttle, location issues”
Reviews.Author: WineloverVirginia
Reviews.Content: 1. Heat--no in-room means to regulate heat--staff had to do it from their central console. When I told them to cut it off--too hot!--we nearly froze overnight! 2. Two clickers--30 buttons each? No instructions--what are the chances of getting the TV working? Less than zero--have to hit another button on a console unit under the desk! Oh, right. 3. Take your narrow wheelie suitcase--that's the width of your room between the bed and the walls--yes, seriously. This room is not competitive! 4. Don't sign up for the shuttle--they hang it on their website, but, you're on your own to coordinate! Call a taxi yourself--they called one for me--the meter was at 6.5 euro when we got in--told this was SOP. Oh, right. 5. Shady night clubs one street over late. BTW, the Opera square is under a complete construction redo--its a mess. 6. Asked for a refund in an email--told I own the problems. Operator error. Man up, senor. Your hotel sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Deal”
Reviews.Author: Debsen1
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel Meninas for 3 days, and it was great. The hotel staff were really helpful and we were able to check in before noon since our flight got in that morning. The location is right near Palace Royal and walking distance to many signts, like the Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, etc. The staff helped out on how to get to different places via walking or the metro, and also restaurant recommendations. The metro (Opera) stop is right near by, and easy to use. The hotel is boutique elegant, and the rooms are clean and nice. There is a computer to use in the lobby, and quite a spread at breakfast. The only drawback is what some others have posted, which is that the garbage collectors come at 3AM. So if you're a sound sleeper or who can fall asleep again easily shuoldn't be a problem, or just bring a pair of earplugs. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Teresa055
Reviews.Content: We loved the location, so close to the metro and attractions. I loved Madrid, one my favorite places in Europe. The hotel rooms have a nice charm. Hardwood floors in the rooms over laminate would have really made the place top notch. However, that is minor. Bathroom was large. Beds were comfortable. The only negative we experienced was we were facing the street and there was a lot of noise all night long (I think there is a bar across the street). I had a horrible sleep all three nights we were there. Granted it was during the time Spain won the FIFA won the cup...so that isn't probably the best time to judge it. However, soundproof windows would really improve the sleep quality. I can't really comment on the breakfast buffet because I never enjoyed any of the breakfast while I was in Europe. Way too much dryed meat,cheese and bread for my liking. Beautiful presentation though and a cool vibe in the basement breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_HScotland
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely helpful and cheerful but at the same time professional. Room was clean and very comfortable. Can be a bit noisy due to the bins being uplifted but who cares, the Spanish do not recognise noise and it keeps the streets clean. One downside is the lack of boiling water in the restaurant for tea but if you have a coffee, problem solved. This hotel has got to be one of the best bargains in Madrid. I will be back next spring. Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nancyL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Meninas for 5 nights, departing on Nov.3. Everything about this hotel met or exceeded our expectations. The location, literally a few steps from a metro station, and just a short walk from one of the most busy and exciting streets of the city, is perfect. They are near many of the "must see" sights in the city and yet just far away from the noise to be quiet. The breakfast is extensive and very tasty. The staff was friendly, spoke excellent English and couldn't have been more helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and sound proof quiet. great breakfast, honest ansd freindly management”
Reviews.Author: Urrr
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed and we missed our connecting flight - had to arrive one day later. The Hotel management did not charge us for the missed night - incredible management! The hotel is located. right were it happens but nevertheless is sound proof - perfectly quiet. Don't let the modest and a bit not-impressive entrance fool you. Our room with two beds was spaceous and comfortable, very clean and with nice decore which looks new. The breakfast is good. The oranges are frshly squeezed and the fruits are frsh. I have never seen so many cakes in an "included breakfast". To sum it up, I will whole heartedly recommend this hotel to my freinds and family.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: PeterS538
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 days while in Madrid. Location next to the Opera metro stop and within walking distance to many attractions is a real plus. The rooms (junior suites) were spacious, well appointed and clean. the breakfast that came with the room was fine with many choices. The Hotel staff were helpful and pleasant. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value All Round”
Reviews.Author: JimbobAberdare
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a three day break at the Meninas Hotel, Madrid in September 2010, The Hotel is well located just off the Grand Via and close to the Opera metro,which makes it convenient if you are travelling from the aiport to the hotel on the metro (single fare 2 euros) from Opera it is a short walk across Plaza de Isabel to the hotel. rooms are modern and comfortable, I was not aware of any significant street noise and the hotel provides a very good buffett style breakfast. staff are friendly, speak fluent English and are very ready to help with restaurant bookings, where they seemed to have some influence, for instance booking us a table at the restaurante sobrino de botin on a saturday night, as a result of the location we were able to walk to the Prado, and other museo, and also to the nightlife, restaurants and bars in La Latina and Lavapies expect to pay around 120 euros per night, I would certainly return to the Hotel Meninas in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Irritating Problems Nearly Drove Honeymooners to Divorce!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingexpat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the photos and reviews of this hotel and found a great price through its website - under €100 per night including breakfast for the Mini Double room (i.e. cheapest double). We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 3-week honeymoon tour and really just wanted to relax. However, this is not a good place to do so. The decor is charming but is hiding a multitude of problems. All went well until we woke up the first morning in a puff of cigarette smoke - though in a non-smoking room. It must be the ventilation system. We got out as quickly as we could (not wanting all of our stuff to absorb the smell) and asked for a different room. The desk clerk acted like he didn't understand how it could smell but we insisted and he gave us another Mini Double. (We asked if he wanted to go up to experience it for himself but he was not allowed to leave the desk - funny, as we had to wait for other clerks who were outside smoking at other times). We wanted to stay in the room during the hot afternoon hours and watch a movie. However, there was a terrible buzzing noise coming from the circuit board which was cutting into our brains and driving us nuts. This is apparently a recurring problem that the hotel does not intend to fix. Their suggestion was to remove the key that controls the electricity of the room - so, to go without electricity. But then we wouldn't be able to watch a movie. They offered us the only other room "of our type" available and said that we should try it first, as they did not recommend it. We went in for 5 minutes and could hear the clerk's conversations with guests checking-in and the subway. We nearly got divorced arguing about which room was worse and we finally decided to keep the room with buzzing noise and no light. The DVD selection was terrible and we decided just to get out of the hotel. Also, there was no wifi signal in any of the rooms we tried. The clerks are obviously taught to empathize with guests but convince them that they have no power beyond exchanging bad rooms for even worse rooms. The fact that other rooms were available but that we were not given an upgrade was a terrible insult. As budget travelers, we feel that we were treated as second-class guests. And for the final blow, after we left we realized that we didn't get the complimentary glass of sangria that was promised when we made our reservation and advertised throughout the whole month on their website. What a shame, as it's in a great location. Luckily, there's a Room Mate Hotel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmonestero
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Meninas in September and had a great stay. We arrived earlier than the normal check-in time, but they let us check in right away and settle into our room. The room itself was a good size, nice decor and very clean. The location was excellent, very short walk to the Opera metro stop and the Palacio Real. There was a lot of construction going on nearby the hotel, so we were worried about noise, but in our room we had no problems and it was quiet. Breakfast was included in our stay and had good selection of pastries, meats, breads and also a hot pan with sausage and eggs. They also offered an airport transfer for 12 Euros that can be added on to your hotel bill, which was convenient for us and easy to arrange. Overall, this was a great hotel and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but bring ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: JamesHTexas
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a Friday to Tuesday stay in a 5th floor junior suite. The room was large and comfortable with excellent twin/double bedding. The bathroom had double sinks and decent water pressure in the shower, however the door shutting off the toilet was difficult to close, and the vent fan was very loud. Housekeeping was excellent as the room always looked and felt clean. The location was great and above all felt safe; the nearby (1/2 block) Opera metro remains open even with major construction in the plaza, but most major tourist sites are within walking distance. We thought the breakfast (free with internet booking) was excellent and provided the most complete selection of our stay in Spain with offerings of various breads, cereals, scrambled and hard boiled eggs, ham and other meats, several juices, and coffee/tea. Availability at 7:30AM meant we could even have breakfast the day of our morning flight. Only 2 caveats: loud noise from the streets until 4:00AM means you should bring the ear plugs. Second, the internet was the slowest I've encountered since dial-up days. Stay here and splurge for the bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location good boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BarbedWirePreston
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a fly hotel package with Easy Jet. Decided we would use the metro to access the city from the airport. Hotel Meninas is on a street just off the Plaza Isabel II, where the Opera House and the Opera metro stop are. This involved 3 different line changes (with luggage) . Most platforms are accessed by escalators however be aware that some of these were out of use for maintenance and generally access to the outside pavement is via several flights of steps. Plaza Isabel II is presently undergoing some major rebuilding and only one entrance to the Opera Metro is open, from which you need to navigate your way round the edge of the square through the building work. We purchased a 5 day metro ticket ( euro 16pp)which includes the airport be aware that the ticket expires on the fifth day and doesn't run a strict 24 hours from time purchased.We had to buy a single ticket back to the airport that being said was only euro2pp. Once at Hotel Meninas we checked in without any issue our room 408 was at the end of quiet corridor with a window looking into a very narrow quadrant ( you really don't have a view only the sky above). Rooms are very nicely decorated (modern style) bathroom with large shower nicely appointed and clean. Air con proved to be an slight issue couldn't set the temperature lower than 22degrees. TV system a little confusing with 3 remotes to use the equipment (after seeing the front desk sorted this out .For us Brits no english channels available in room BBC World on in the foyer). As is usual for european hotels no Tea coffee facilities in room . Take your kettle. There is a small fridge (minibar) for you to keep milk in if required. Double bed in our room. Next time would probably ask for 2 singles as use to a King/Super king bed . We didn't have breakfast in the hotel.Lots of cafes and places available for breakfast throughout the city.. TWO MUST DO'S: Mercado de San Miguel just of Calle Mayor. This place was great in the evening for all things Tapas don't take an organised tour around the city just go here and do your own Tour of all the stalls; you can have a full meal here just perusing all the goodies on offer. Footie Fans: Do the guided tour of the Real Madrid Stadium at the Bernabeu. Wonderful tour you get to access virtually everywhere including the football benchs the changing rooms,the pitch,museum you c\n even have a picture taken with your favourite football star. For all us ladies of a certain age out there I've put in a request for you to be able to have your photo taken with Jose. We then had lunch in the restaurant. A little expensive but worth it for the view alone. (food was very nice as well). We did the audio tour of the Royal Palace well worth the money, the one thing we felt was a little over the top was the commentary in the Armoury . (Far too long for us) Lots of famous museums choose one. Make sure you spend time outdoors and wander the lovely parks (Retiro, Park O'est and casa de campo (where there is a cable car back to Park Oest with terrific views of the city and Palace.)) Will definately return to Madrid and would love to stay at The Meninas next time round. (Location for us was superb)

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: MomocaLondon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I had to wait for ages to get to my room, which was crammed and windowless. But above all, it stank of cigarettes. I was eventually sent to another room. Which hadn't been cleaned, dirty sheets and all! I was then told that there were no rooms available, despite having made that reservation! I finally got a room. Tiny, cramped, windowless. No wifi. Avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Deedee9971
Reviews.Content: In few words: excellent clean great location frendly staff design nice bathroom great breakfast very very good bed and pillows

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: krice65
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect little hotel in the old town of Madrid. It is located steps from the royal palace, excellent restaurants, a short walk to Gran Via for great shopping, and near the Mercado de San Miguel, our favorite food place in Madrid. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated, the bathroom was very nice, and the room was very functional for my husband and I, and our two girls, ages 8 and 3. The couch folds out to a nice comfortable bed (nothing like the awkward American pull-out sofas), and there was plenty of space for everything. My father had a single room, and while it was very small, it was perfectly functional, and perfect for a single traveler. For those with families, get the quadruple room and you will be just fine. The breakfast buffet was pretty good; it had something for everyone. The staff was responsive and attentive. I made my reservations on the hotel website itself; I found the best prices and availability there. Again, the location cannot be beat if you are there to see the old Madrid, the palace and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Travel4me1a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a centrally located hotel in Madrid, and saw the great previous reviews for this hotel. We also had a great experience! The hotel is easily accessible from the Opera Metro stop (we took the train right in from the airport). A short walk, and you're there. The staff are all very friendly, and everyone spoke fluent English. The hotel is immaculate, and very modern in style. Yes, the rooms are small, but it did the job for us (again clean, friendly, and centrally located for our tours). No complaints here. Would recommend, and would stay here next time again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful haven in the hot, dusty days of August”
Reviews.Author: Evansthecat
Reviews.Content: We were four couples that visited Madrid the first week of August and stayed two nights at the Meninas. It was around 9am when we arrived at the hotel from the States and the staff were extrememly pleasant and accomodating. I had notified them in advance that we wished to store our luggage while we did some sightseeing, but they were immediately able to offer us two rooms where we could put our bags, use the toilet and wash our travel weary faces. The other two rooms were ready when we returned from the Prado mid-afternoon. As far as the size of rooms, they did vary (ours was a good size and had a large closet and enormous bathroom,even if the room size itself wasn't large). The airconditioning functioned brilliantly and all of our friends said they were the most comfortable beds we had on the entire trip. The breakfast was wonderful both in quality and variety. Yogurts, pastry, eggs, juices, breads and lots of good coffee. The hotel is on a sweet little street, but there was construction down on the corner that went on all day-suprising to us in the 100 degree weather. City living necessitates night time trash pickup and being on the front side of the hotel we came awake briefly as they dropped a new dumpster for the neighborhood. We came back one afternoon to clean up before we headed out for chocolate and churros and the power was out in the hotel. The staff said the construction crew had cut a line. Emergency lights were on, and the manager was running around lighting candles so that we could sit and visit in the lobby which remained cool. By the time we got back the power had been restored. We found all of the staff friendly and with a good sense of humor. We had stopped at the tapa bar associated with the sister hotel Opera and when the lady tending the bar passed through the lobby of our hotel the next morning she waved and acknowledged us. If you want to be assured of quiet, do ask for an inner room. There is a light shaft, so they aren't too dark, but they do seem to be the smaller rooms. The hotel is convenient to many sites, especially the palace and the metro station is very near. Next time we're in Madrid, we will be back at the Meninas.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the generally inexpensive price...not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: monacogirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. I would say there were some great aspects but some drawbacks. First the location is super. Near the PalaceReal and Opera metro..within walking distance to PlazaMayor. The rooms were super clean and our family really enjoyed the breakfast that was included. But understand the rooms here are super super small, even for a European hotel. We had two rooms and both were just slightly larger than the bed and desk. No where to put your suitcase without tripping on it! Also, the rooms are very noisy. You can hear every noise at all hours from the hallway, doors slamming, talking, etc. But worst of all was that works started repairs in the hotel on our floor at 6:30am. We saw them tiling a room bath! That is ridiculous. Also beware there is building construction on the blocks surrounding the hotel that goes on from early morning until early eve. There is a lot of noise( jackhammering the sidewalks, etc during the day so if you plan on taking a nap after sightseeing...bring heavy duty earplugs. Oh and the desk staff is just ok...don't even raise their heads when you come in. It's fine for the price but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the heart of madrid”
Reviews.Author: esot
Reviews.Content: I don't make it a habit to write about hotels on the net because I don't like to recommend something I am unsure of. And yet I could not resist on this occasion..I have stayed at the Hotel Meninas several times now and can recommend this boutique hotel without a single doubt to all the travellers who want to be in the heart of Madrid, just a few meters from the Opera House; those that love the atmosphere of the historical part of the city and can appreciate the small and picturesque. In this hotel they will also enjoy excellent service and value for money they can always count on.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: TYandJY
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. For 4* with breakfast, under 100 Euros a night and centrally located, we were not sure what to expect. It was a super choice for us. We had a smaller room (504) on the top floor that overlooked the inner courtyard. It was extremely quiet. The only noise we heard in 3 nights was a little talking as other guests walked down the hall. The room had curtains that allowed us to black out the room so we were able to nap anytime of day. The hotel itself is located on a quiet side street minutes from the Opera metro station and the pedestrian friendly Calle del Arenal. It is in a completely renovated historic building with modern amenities, comfortable bed and pillows, modern and clean bathroom, and wood floors. (I hate carpet) We had a room with one double bed, but in future travels to Spain I would request the 2 twin bed option. We learned over time that they were always pushed together and generally you ended up with a larger room as the bed was more King sized. My only issue would have been the petit nature of the room. The breakfast was included in the price but would have cost us 15 Euros each otherwise. Madrid was our first stop on our trip and we appreciated being able to eat a good breakfast when we were jet lagged and heading out for a full day of sightseeing. The breakfast buffet was as good as we have seen anywhere in our travels in Europe. My last comment would be about the extremely helpful staff. Any time of day, any question, they were always pleasant. My husband was interested in finding an authentic paella and the woman at the front desk recommended her favorite place right around the corner on the Plaza de Oriente where we could stare at the Royal Palace as it lit up at nightfall. Our entire dinner still came in under 50 Euros, so we had great ambiance and great food at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in quite street right in the centre”
Reviews.Author: wimbledon2
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel. Although my strong advice is DON’T book through Hotels.com. They screwed up the booking which lost us almost a day of our four day break dragging luggage from one hotel to another and hanging around to check in and out. Despite Hotels.com email confirmation that a twin room had been booked as requested, when we arrived for a four night stay, the confirmation they'd sent to the hotel showed a double room had been booked. There were no twin rooms available that night. The hotel staff were very apologetic (even though they were not to blame) and very helpful. They booked a room for us that night at their sister hotel (‘Opera’), which is also 4 star. They said we could either continue our stay at the Opera or come back to stay at Meninas from the following day. So the next morning I walked back to the Meninas and had a look at the room. It was much better than the Opera, so we dragged our luggage back to the Meninas. The staff could not have been more helpful. They dispatched staff up to the room to get it ready as a priority, and we were able to check in and leave our bags and enjoy the rest of our stay in Madrid. The hotel is in a quiet street right in the centre. The room was spacious; twin beds; full bathroom and a wardrobe /changing area in between the bedroom and bathroom. The breakfast was very good. The staff helped us get our bearings and gave us a map and information on things to see and how to get there. My other piece of advice is to book a transfer to/from the hotel. The hotel will do this for you. We used public transport on the way to the hotel and it was a bit of a nightmare. Lots and lots of steps to negotiate in the metro stations. I would most definitely stay at the Meninas if I go back to Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: gansonwheels
Reviews.Content: As a boutique hotel the rooms were on the small side but nevertheless comfortable and the bathroom was a good size (best shower in 2 weeks). It was situated 10 minutes from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Staff were very helpful and arranged taxi to airport despite heavy demand caused by Metro strike.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: causeway00000
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is it's location. It's a 7 minute walk to Puerto de Sol, which will give you access to ALL major metro lines...but if you need a closer stop, it's literally a 2 minute walk to the Opera station. The Palacio Real is basically the hotel's backyard. VERY CONVENIENT. The walls of the hotel are a bit on the thin side. Let's just say I was able to hear a couples' "fun night" from the halls. So bring headphones and good music to drown out the noises. The location is hard to beat, so if you're looking for something centrally located, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: maestraWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched for hotels online and knew the location I wanted because I had been to Madrid before. I found Meninas--great location (5 minutes to Sol and Plaza Mayor, Gran Via and more!!). We absolutly loved the hotel and will definitely stay again. We made reservations for a trip during our time in Madrid and they stored our luggage for us because we had reservations upon our return (not a problem at all). I had a few questions and emailed them and they responded very quickly. My friend left her bag on the shuttle and because I was staying on in Madrid (not at a hotel), I emailed them and they contacted the shuttle and had the bag within a day! I absolutly will stay here again when I return! Very clean (small rooms but very typcal in Europe), great reception area and lobby along with a great breakfast buffet (the tortilla espanola is wonderful). I can´t say enough about this hotel (it is on a small one way street within a block of the Opera metro stop so it is quiet but still close to the action).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: United_Chick
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The location is wonderful. It's within a two minute walk to the Palacio Real. Great restaurants and shopping are also close by. The subway is across the street, but it is almost unnecessary as it is only a short walk to the Gran Via, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, San Gines Church, and the other Madrid must-dos. You can even walk to the Prado, though this is a slightly more ambitious trip. The rooms were gorgeous. The hotel is very trendy and modern, but the rooms were also very comfortable. We had a junior suite, which consisted of two rooms with three beds and a huge bathroom. We even had three Juliet balconies. It's nice to be able to open the doors and look onto the street. I only paid $170 for a night in a suite, so I am not really sure why the few negative reviews had issues with value. I suggest you book directly through the hotel's website as some of the travel sites had significantly higher rates for Meninas. The front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out went quickly and smoothly. They also arranged for us to take a picnic with us when we checked out for our early flight since we wouldn't be able to have the breakfast buffet that’s included in the room price. I will definitely be staying here again! The location cannot be beat and the rooms were absolutely fantastic. I couldn't have asked for anything more. I should also mention that I had a great stay at this hotel's sister hotel, Hotel Opera. While I really enjoyed it and they are virtually next to each other, Hotel Meninas just has nicer rooms. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: notsooriginalname
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in the opera district, close to tourist sites. Breakfast was amazing, staff was friendly. Rooms were clean and up-to-date.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential... So little delivery”
Reviews.Author: sjgjess1
Reviews.Content: Here's the problem - the service at this place is out of this world. Absolutely the cutest people ever work at the desk, and even the housekeeper is adorable. However, the hotel is a wannabe. Yes, there are cool wood-laminate floors, and, yes, the bathroom is covered in natural stone, but still there is something lacking: comfort. The television has 4 channels (and the only English channel is one that attempts to TEACH English... very bizarre). That's a real bummer in a 4 star hotel that costs $180 per night. I really don't expect Spanish hotels to cater to the English-speaking guests, but at the same time, the competing hotels spring for CNN. Why not the Meninas? Additionally, the Internet is not wireless - only with a cord that barely works. The bed was terribly small and hard, and in the mornings, every single door shut on the floor sounded like it was being slammed in our room. I had a meeting in the morning, and I felt as though I had been run over by an 18-wheeler - and I had no jetlag by this point by the way. I would absolutely NOT stay at the Meninas again... although I don't know exactly what the better option is. In truth, the location is unbeatable, but it does not compensate for the uncomfortable night spent at the Meninas.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jcrichton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Meninas on 2 occassions over a total of 5 nights on our recent trip to Madrid and Salamanca and we totally concur with all the very positive reviews previously posted about this Hotel. On both times the rooms were of a very high standard and spotlessly clean, as was the bathrooms. The buffet breakfast (which was included in the room rate) was superb with an excellent choice of hot and cold dishes. The reception staff were friendly and helpful (they retained our luggage for the 2 nights we were in Salamanca). The hotel's location is another plus point with it being only a short walk from the Royal Palace; Plaza Major and the Puerta del Sol. Getting to the hotel from the airport by metro is fairly straightforward though it does require 2 changes - takes approx 45 minutes to get to the Opera station and costs a mere 2 euros. We certainly enjoyed our 2 stays in the Meninas - highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: John55
Reviews.Content: I cCannot fault our stay at this hotel. Central location, quiet side street, public areas and room all in very good order, excellent breakfast. A great base for sightseeing. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of the REAL necessity...”
Reviews.Author: andru86
Reviews.Content: Hotel Meninas is in a prime location, and has all the necessary amenities that one needs. The rooms are chic and modern, however, its space was not optimized as the bathroom was really spacious relative to the room size. I must say, my stay at this hotel was rather unpleasant. A hotel may have top notch amenities and features, however, if it lacks the most basic feature, then such primitive hotel cannot be and should not be compared to other leading hotels. Hotel Meninas is a 4-star hotel, and not cheap relative to other counterparts due to its location. When I am paying $150 - $200 for a night, I expect to get good sleep from the hotel. Unfortunately, I did not get good rest, which has a detrimental effect for your schedule if you are a tourist. The circuit board in the room made a loud buzzing noise, although my girlfriend and I are not sensitive to small noise, that noise really irritated us. After seeking 6 hours of sleep, due to the noise, we only got 2 hours of sleep. When we woke up at 10:45, we called the reception if we can still make it for the breakfast (as BK is open until 11), upon confirming we went down, only to be shut down by a staff saying that it was closed. I looked at my watch and said we still got 15 minutes, and she brushed it off, and we were forced to leave. When we told the reception about the noise from the circuit board, they seemed to have known about this problem. They called the electrician to fix it, and I was guaranteed that it should be fixed. Due to this mishap, our tour started at 11 and made a trip to Palacio Real, only to come back 2 hours later since we were so exhausted. At night when we came back, we were notified that an electrician has resolved the issue. We must say, that the electrician was a brilliant genius, as s/he tried minimizing noise by forcefully sticking in a cardboard to close the opening, rather than perhaps fixing the actual electrical circuit board. Bravo to the hotel, and the hired electrician… thanks to that, 1 hour sleep on our last night. When I confronted them about the problem, the receptionist said she’s truly sorry, but please sign the receipt. Normally, I’d fight about paying for the last night, but due to no sleep, we were extremely late for our train ride to Sevilla. My experience at this hotel may have been just a bad luck, but there’s this benefit of doubt that the problem has been a recurring incident, which upsets me. Plus the internet connection in the room was really poor, and i had to use the wifi in the lobby, which impaired my business work. All in all, I do not recommend and will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great room!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed for 5 nights on the top floor in one of the loft rooms. It was a really large room, the hotel does not skimp on anything. Stacks of towels, pillows, toiletries in the room. The breakfast is nothing short of amazing, you certainly don't need lunch. Great location, really quiet and easy walking to all the galleries and plaza's. Just a great spot, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: cquad40
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel. Staff were friendly, but the room wasVERY small (hardly find a place for my luggage) and noisy (heard a lot from the neighbour room). Location is OK. Has a nice lobby to relax with free wifi and computer. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel - Fine for a leisure, not recommendable for work”
Reviews.Author: FerrisXL
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this little boutique hotel. It's at a very central location, has a hip design and friendly and helpful staff . The rooms are equipped not only with TV, but also with a DVD player, which is a plus. I slept very well in the comfortable bed. However, the rooms are tiny and the lightening is not very good. Also, the internet connection both in the room and the lobby was very slow. So, it is not really suitable for people having to work in the hotel. For this reason I moved to another hotel after one night. I will consider coming back to this hotel when visiting Madrid for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped rooms, useless staff - why is this hotel so overrated??”
Reviews.Author: Renoyd
Reviews.Content: Location is not OK, not great, on a quiet short curved street which is nice. The place is clean. OK, that's it for the good part. Only the 3 front rooms on floors are decent; the rest are tiny and very cramped. My desk chair had no room; it jammed against the bed and I had to move garbage can across the room for a place to put my legs to use the small desk! No windows, just a lightshaft, dull lighting. Not a good place to do any kind of work. Breakfast room is marginal and in the basement, again, no windows, not good karma. Staff, (I had experience with most of them), is basicially useless, if you need any kind of advice or assistance with anything, forget it; the concept of "concierge" is totally unknown here. In addition, there was: an important needed message handed to me casually more than 24 hours after it came in, as I was walking out the door for the day, not even put under my door!; no help whatsoever with anything, including any cash-out against my imprinted credit card, etc or any kind of suggestions, after my wallet with all cash and credit cards was stolen on the street, (yes I was warned and careful about Barcella and Madrid; the thieves are state of the art); no help or ideas on finding cultural events listings in English, just shrugs, and then I find exactly the current directory I needed, right in their own lobby! I don't need or expect the Ritz, but come on! And there are better bargains to be found. If you need absolutely nothing from a hotel staff, you have everything planned and handled, and you can get one of the few front roooms, than consider this, otherwise look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: rudee2010
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel with subtle, modern and tasteful decor, quiet and spacious lobby. Staff were friendly, effiicient and available. Great buffet breakfast choice and presentation. The location was brilliant, with most attractions within a 20 minute stroll and about 100 yards from the Ópera Metro station. Being an old building the room was on the smallish side, however, has an excellent wardrobe that allowed use of the available space and the hotel building had enough character. being set in a quiet street, there was absolutely no noise at night, which is amazing given that the hotel's location is near the Opera House. The sister hotel Café Opera round the corner provided a small gmn (if you really want it in a city break) and a cafe with wi-fi. The Meninas also had free wi-fi We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: nicolegal78
Reviews.Content: The Meninas is conveniently located near the Opera and within quick walking distance from the Plaza Mayor, the Mercato San Miguel, and the Royal Palace. The lobby and rooms are modern with dark wood floors and nice amenities. Our room faced an inner courtyard with cute cartoons painted on the outer walls. The room was quiet at night as well. The front desk was very helpful and provided great service. The breakfast room downstairs had a good selection of cakes and sweets and of course jamon. For the price and based on the location, Hotel Meninas was an excellent value. Plus the little princess appears on absolutely everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brownie0022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Meninas Hotel for 2 nights. The location is the best part about this hotel. It is tucked away on a quiet street with little thru traffic. It is close walking distance to many sites in the city. In regards to the hotel, it has a contemporary feel to it and is a small, boutique hotel. Our room was rather small and the bathroom had a stand up shower. Our TV didn't get reception and although we asked the front desk staff a couple of times, we were not able to get someone to come fix it. However, we really weren't in Madrid to watch TV! The front desk staff was very friendly but we didn't utilize them much because there was usually only one person at the front and they were usually on the phone. Overall, it is a nice hotel, a step above your basic hotel but the location and price makes it worth it. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WitzinCville
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Meninas in late March 2010. My wife and I shared one room, and our two teenage daughters shared another room. We could not have asked for a better location. The hotel is less than a block from the Opera House, and is easy walking distance from Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, and nearly all the major museums. Our rooms were small, but well appointed and very clean. We had rooms on the fifth floor, and things were very quiet. The breakfast buffet was quite good. The front desk staff were all very nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel with ambience”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Upon arrival, we were assigned a small room near the back of the hotel. We enjoy a room with a view so I went back down to the reception desk to ask and received a bigger room with french doors facing the main street.The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. Bathrooms clean with plenty of amenities; toothbrush and toothpaste, comb, shoe horn, soap, shampoo, lotion, tissues. Mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The location is perfect, within 5-10 minutes walking distance to Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor. There are plenty of restaurants, shops and banks nearby. (The Sandler Banks do not charge a commission to exchange money). The Opera Metro is 3 minutes from the hotel. Our stay included breakfast so we were treated to pastries, fruits, meats/cheeses, scrambled eggs, bacon, spanish omlete, churros, desserts, coffee, juice, tea, hot chocolate in the breakfast room. The hotel has a free computer in the reception lobby. It was a pleasant stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: ACT73
Reviews.Content: A friend and I chose Meninas for a recent four day trip to Madrid, based among other on the very positive reviews the hotel received on this site. Although the location and the building itself lived up to expectations, the overall experience was disappointing. When checking into the room around 14:00 the first day (after strolling around for two hours following arrival, leaving the staff sufficient time to clean), I arrived in a 5th floor corridor and room where the air was stale (from smoking?), the room extremely dusty (floors had not been vaccum cleaned and there was a centimeter of dust on top of all mirrors, frames and other surfaces) and the bathroom superficially cleaned (traces of other people's use, including hair and dental cream, visible everywhere). The worst was the air filter in the bathroom, which was so grey and dusty it looked like it had not been touched for five years. As I suffer from dust allergy, I imemdiately felt pain in my eyes and my lungs, and I contacted the reception. They offered to send somebody to clean, but as I desperately needed some rest, we agreed that the room would be cleaned later in the afternoon, when my friend and I would go out for sightseeing/dinner. When we returned in the evening, there was NO improvement (nobody had cleaned), and the reception manger offered us to move to Hotel Opera down the street. As it was late and we had unpacked, we declined, but asked him to kindly leave a note for housekeeping the next morning, pointing out exactly what they should pay particular attention to. To make a long story short, there was absolutely no improvement in the cleaning the following two days, and I doubt if the staff in Meninas do anything more than make the beds when guests are staying. They certainly don't clean/use detergents in the bathroom, and the floors were never vaccum cleaned. In addition, the whole atmosphere of the room was rather cold and very far from the cosy rooms I have gotten use to in other hotels of this type/price level (for example the Aston hotel in London). The lighting was insufficient, there was no water kettle to make coffee/tea (standard in most boutique hotels), and the TV was a small PC screen which had seen better days. Another big minus was that the PC down in the reception area had an internet connection slower than anything I have experienced in recent years (even in Eastern Europe), and when I pointed out to the hotel reception that I could not even access my email to check my departure flight, they were again quick to offer Hotel Opera as an alternative..I tried to point out that as far as I book and pay to stay at a specific hotel, I am not really interested in having to rely on another one to provide the services I require, but they did not seem to understand. In general, although the reception staff was forthcoming, they did not possess the kind of information we would expect. When we asked them to recommend a good Asian restaurant, they suggested Italian (...), and when we asked for good quality shopping (small boutiques, Spanish design), they suggested one of the typical high streets. I think some it may be explained by insufficient languages skills/difficulties in understanding, but still, it did not help the overall experience. Finally, the breakfast was just as good as expected from other reviews, but again, the juice glasses were. without exception, dirty (surely only superficially rinsed in hot water) and even the plates bore occassional traces of food. All in all, I came home after a four days stay with swollen eyes (from dust allergy), a desire to take a shower, and to go to bed in clean sheets, and that is not how I expect to feel after a week-end break. I have stayed at a variety of hotels in the same category in the last 3-4 months, in Athens, Bratislava, Tallinn and London, and they all offered much better value for money. Hotel Meninas = disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not perfect...”
Reviews.Author: marcoclaudio
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights for the weekend. had chosen it based on the great reviews and though all in all I found it a good choice I was expecting something more. The room was nice, regular size, with a small balcony and a big bathroom. Nice dark wood floor, modern decor. the problem was with the windows fittings not good enough so that the noise from the street during the night (what were they moving up and down the street?) was quite disturbing and a cold draft came trhough the window. I had chosen an external room to have more light but probably was not a good choice. The pluses were location in the historical centre, just off plaza mayor and more importantly close enough to the restaurants and tapas bars in calle baja and a good breakfast served in a cellar but pleasantly lit with a good variety of juices, cakes and a hearty tortilla. you can travel by metro as the Opera stop is just 50 meters away and in 40 mins you can be at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RhodamGreaterLondon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated at a stone's trow from the Prado and the city center. The service was very good and friedly, you can always expect a warm welcome here. The room was a bit little but clean and comfortable. At the and of the day it really deserves a visit, and we'll turn back to this Hotel next time we'll visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a very nice spot to stay in Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jamesanderson84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meninas for three nights. We arrived off a redeye before official check-in time and they had a room ready for us after making a request the night before (personally I think this is one of those true tests of service for a hotel - do they go the extra mile). The room was at the rear and was very quiet. The hotel is very centrally located near Opera - but the street the hotel is on is one way and never had much traffic on it during our stay. There are restaurants of different styles at the bottom, top and middle of the street - and one is in easy walking distance to stores. The museums are a little farther away - but if the weather was good it would be an easy 20 minute walk to the Prado and Thyssen and Reina Sofia museums. The room was small - as one has to accept for a city center European hotel - but comfortable and very clean. Breakfast was included but was just OK. We went round the corner to the Cafe de Opera because the coffee and atmosphere were better,

Reviews.Title: “A delightful little boutique hotel gem--one of my all-time faves!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal401
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this great little hotel. If you like boutique european-style hotels that offer a little slice of near-real life, then this is the place for you. If you like big, impersonal American hotel chains on the main tourist strip, then you will not like this hotel. Location--is excellent. About half a block away from the Opera metro stop and a few minutes from several major attractions. Yet it is on a quiet residential-ish street that makes you feel like you are really in Madrid and not tourist-land. Rooms--the rooms are small (typical), but modern, stylish and extremely clean. Beautifully decorated. A little flat-screen tv on the wall that gets a couple English stations (for your siesta). I believe there is also a sound system and wifi, but I did not use either during my stay. One of the best bathrooms I've ever had traveling in Europe. Modern, relatively large, and they give you products. Beds weren't great, but were not oppressive either. You won't get views from this hotel, my room overlooked an airshaft at the back of the hotel, but this wasn't an issue for me. I think at best you would face the street, which is small and relatively quiet. Hotel Amenities--there is a public computer, which I was able to use to get online without any trouble or having to wait. A small lounge, but no restaurant. The hotel serves breakfast (a large buffet) in a dining room downstairs. Pretty standard options, fruit, tortilla, cereals, coffee, juice, pastries. There is a convenience store up the block where you can buy water, snacks, etc. There is not really a market or food stand nearby. THe building is (I believe) a 19th century building, but in excellent condition. They have a beautiful original staircase. There is a small elevator if you are on a higher floor or don't want to lug your bags up stairs. Staff--Joachim (? I might be forgetting--he is there during the day) was absolutely delightful. Friendly, helpful, accomodating and nice. One of the other later-night desk staff was not as helpful, but wasn't rude. Even housekeeping was helpful--when I arrived early, they accidentally almost put me in a room that was still occupied. The housekeeper caught it and kept me from trying the door! I would absolutely stay here again! Thanks Hotel Meninas!

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: Augusto26
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Madrid, and stayed at Hotel Meninas. The hotel is perfect. Excellent location (next to the subway station and the Royal Palace). The service was excellent, room and bathroom very clean. The staff were very healpfull. Free internet access. Note 10 to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-located, excellent service; breakfast is a strong feature even with a couple of weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: jujusticks
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in mid-December 2009. The hotel is located on a quiet street just off a plaza at the end of one of the main pedestrian drags in Madrid. We experienced no street noise while sleeping, but could walk to all the standard tourist sites and effortlessly join the Madrilenos on their evening paseos. Palacio Real is a 2 minute walk; the Prado is 15-20. The front desk staff was quite helpful and friendly, offering good advice even in response to some rather off-the-wall questions. No doorman and a couple of steps up to the reception area. We did not always speak to front desk staff in English but when we did, their English was excellent. We had small rooms on the second floor (207 and 202, I think) with windows opening onto an interior courtyard. Interior noise dampening within the hotel was good to very good. Rooms were much like what you would expect from a mid-range boutique hotel in NYC: compact square footage, streamlined modern furnishings, very clean, with comfortable, good-quality bedding. Unlike some reviewers, we experienced no trouble at all adjusting the climate control to keep the rooms warm. The lobby includes a reading area, communal bookshelf, DVD library, and a desktop with internet access. Breakfast was good to very good and included in our room rate. Ample buffet with a wide variety: coffee, mineral water, orange, peach, and pineapple juice, fresh fruits, cold cuts and cheese, sliced bread and a variety of rolls, cereal, yogurt, tortilla espanola, churros, an abundant selection of cakes, and a few hot things in chafing dishes like bacon and scrambled eggs. I read a few negative reviews of the breakfast and agree with only one point: the cups, glasses and cutlery could use a more vigorous dishwashing. Most days the four of us encountered at least one item with something stuck or caked on. It is true most of the food is not hot, and Meninas definitely appears to be operating without its own full kitchen, but the the temperatures were fine. Most items on the menu were intended to be served at room temperature, including the tortilla. Sure, it would have been nice to have churros straight out of a deep fryer, but that's not the deal here. Once we did encounter a slice of stale bread at the end of a row, but we just took the next slice in. The dining room is on the basement level but we did not find it dark or claustrophobic at all. Overall we found the ample buffet with good quality food to be an excellent value for fueling ourselves before setting off to explore on foot. If it were up to me I would turn off the blaring U.S. pop music in the dining room, but that is definitely a matter of taste...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveUK1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Meninas during our trip to Madrid for New Year 2009/2010. The location is perfect, very close to the Metro and within walking distance of all the major city centre attractions, but at the same time on a quiet road off the main square which limited the traffic and people noise. The staff were excellent and very helpful. The room was good – decent size for a European city hotel, clean and well looked after. We faced out onto the street and had a very small balcony which helped the room have a light and more spacious feel to it. A word of caution, we were shown another double room on the inside of the hotel (facing an internal courtyard of sorts) and it was very dark and had a tiny window looking out on a brick wall which made it feel very inhospitable – avoid those rooms as our stay would have been very different had we stayed in there. All rooms have internet access if you have a cable (they can lend you one) or there is WiFi in the lobby area. The breakfast, included in our rate, was ok and had both hot and cold options but we tended to stay on the bread and pastries as the cooked breakfast wasn’t all that great. Breakfast ran till 11am which means you aren’t rushed in the morning. Overall the Meninas is a good, solid, small city centre hotel. It is not a luxury boutique hotel by any means but for 130 Euro a night it is an excellent choice for a city break and one we would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: jacquie6London
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in this charming hotel. Location was excellent, rooms comfortable and clean; staff (although some speaking limited English) were helpful, friendly and efficient. The breakfast buffet was outstanding - lots of fresh fruit; huge choice of interesting foods. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: mustang-five
Reviews.Content: Meninas was a pleasant surprise. Very well located near the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, etc. and a very tidy room with a nice view. Breakfast was also good and the staff were exceptionally friendly. The only down side was the noise from the adjacent square and street which sometimes lasted until the early morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it.”
Reviews.Author: Jan-in-Seattle_WA
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel on a fairly quiet (for Madrid) street. We had the jr. suite. The balconies were nice (although the only room available was right above the entrance to the hotel, so it was noisy), but I don't know that the living room area was worth the extra cost, it was quite small and not that comfy. The breakfast buffet (free with the reservation on the internet) was fabulous. Wonderful pasteries, fruit, an egg dish and sausage, etc. Front desk staff speak limited English, but are friendly. The hotel is an easy walk to the metro (Opera station) and the Royal Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: PukkaSahib
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a quiet little street near the opera, easy walking distance from all major sights in Madrid, making it a perfect location. Our room was quite small, but very comfortable and tasteful and wonderfully quiet, and that in central Madrid! The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, making the stay in the hotel a pleasure. They helped with booking, advice, printing, etc. The only two small downsides are: The cleaning of the rooms, especially the bathrooms, could be much better. Breakfast was served in a very somber basement room. The buffet looked great and did indeed offer a big choice. But much of it, apart from the fresh orange juice, was rather stale. More quality instead of quantity would be good. On the whole a very good hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “A true jewel in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: MariaNewYorkNY
Reviews.Content: Las Meninas is a charming boutique hotel located in a lovely XIX century building in the heart of Madrid. The decor is modern with very clean lines and yet warm and cozy. Service is excellent. The staff is welcoming and attentive, always happy to help. The buffet breakfast is just what you need to start your day on a good note; they even serve freshly made churros! Conveniently situated on the lobby level there is a lounge with a business center. For business or pleasure, Hotel Las Meninas is indeed a jewel in the heart of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Quiet, Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: TowsonHounds
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel as it is located on a small street close to the Opera and the subway. From its location we could walk to Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. The staff was very helpful in setting up reservation for us to local restaurants. They all speak fluent English. The room and bathroom were very clean, modern and comfortable. Being on a small street the hotel was very quiet and even when there was some students partying on the street late one night the concierge settle the matter very quickly by calling the municipal police. Breakfast in the morning is very copious and very fresh. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Apollo14
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel largely for its central location, near the Royal Palace and the surrounding pedestrianised area. In a city like Madrid which can be hectic, its nice to leave your hotel and wander to where there are no cars. The hotel itself is very nice, classical yet modern, which suited my parents (in their seventies). Friendly staff. Clean rooms. *Very good* breakfast included in the room price quoted on their website - another reason to book this hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Meninas on August 9-16, 2009 in a double room. We booked though the hotel's own website and got free breakfast, which was simple but delightful. Hotel's location is great - less than a block away from the Opera subway stop and in close proximity to the Royal Palace. Plaza Mayor is about 10 minutes away on foot. It takes about 20 minutes to get to the Atocha Renfe station and 30-40 minutes to the Chamartin Station. We took a cab from/to airport - about 35-40 euros each way. Our room was decent size and included a safe and a minibar. Beds were hard and not particularly comfortable. The water pressure was poor (4th floor) and a bathroom sink got clogged up all the time. Also, the bathtub had a half-screen rather than a curtain or a full-size screen, which necessitated careful maneuvering on my part to avoid splashing too much water onto the floor. Those are my only complaints. But then again, how much time do you spend inside a hotel room while on vacation? Street noise is considerable but tolerable. I've heard that noise is a problem for most downtown hotels in Madrid. Overall, it's a good base to explore Madrid and its environs.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in modern hotel near everything”
Reviews.Author: Boston519
Reviews.Content: Right at the Opera station, steps away from Plaza de Oriente. My partner and I walked to great tapas bars in La Latina in just a few minutes. Rooms have free internet (not wireless) for your portable computers -- you just have to ask for an ethernet cord at the front desk. Bathroom was very nice and AC worked well to counteract the summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great hotel for visitors”
Reviews.Author: nvylocs
Reviews.Content: I loved it. I read the reviews on here and knew it was a good choice. Even better when I got their book 3 nights, get the 4th free deal. My room rate included breakfast. For four nights, I paid 281 euros total (inclusive of taxes). The location is PERFECT. It is two blocks away from Calle Arenal (major shopping, some restaurants, etc.). One block away from train. Two blocks from Royal Palace (highly recommend). Decent walking distance to Prado, etc. museums. It is perfect bc it is near to all yet tucked away on a quiet street so you can sleep at night. The breakfast was good (plenty of fruit, breads, yogurt, meat, cheese, pastry, juice, coffee, teas). They do have the same thing stuff everyda with little change but there is a lot to choose from. They offer airport transportation for 12 euro per person with a shuttle (not theirs but it is available). I loved it and would stay there again. Internet was free in room and there is a computer you can use downstairs for 15 minutes at a time for free. They do not have adaptors to convert foreign plugs for laptops, etc. or offer to stamp your postcards, but an otherwise great hotel where they speak English with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location (oh and comfortable!)”
Reviews.Author: SFSquirrel_94114
Reviews.Content: great location. blocks from the Palacio Real and the Opera House. easy walk to Latina barrio and the Gran Via, shopping, sightseeing. staff were very friendly and helpful. Don't get excited about the gym or sauna that are actually at their sister hotel (hotel opera) which is just around the corner - although the views are nice. I had the suite which was extemely comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job with keeping it clean and not bothering me while I was in the room. quiet street except for Monday 3am trash collection - but hey that comes with any city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...loved the hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MVOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Madrid and loved this hotel. The location is a very short walk to the Metro Opera Station. The Royal Palace is a ten minute walk, the Plaza de Esanza is only 15 minutes. It is very centrally located to the tourist attractions. We took the Metro to the Retiro Park and the Prado with no problems. The rooms are great. I expected more noise based upon comments here, but Saturday was relatively quiet and Sunday night was very quiet even though our rooms faced the street. We had the junior suite which was perfect for the three of us. The sofa bed had thick mattress and the king bed was very comfortable. We highly recommend the Madrid Segway tour (www.madsegs.com) and the operator. It was great way to get our bearings in the city and the tour guide was very informative and English speaking. I was afraid the morning tour at 1000 hrs would be to hot (three hours) but it was perfect. It is cooler than the afternoon and there is always a breeze when moving on the segway. We ate at a restaurant he recommended called the Casa Mingo which was EXCELLENT. A whole roasted chicken for 9.50 euros, plus the salad and bread. Inexpensive and very good. The hotel is on a side street, easy to find, and very well maintained. The breakfast was included with our rooms and was also very good, fresh pastries, breads, hot eggs, bacon, cheeses, juices, coffee, etc. The rooms are large by European standards, modernly decorated with a large bath.We were in 503. It was usually too hot in the late afternoon to be out, so we would come back and nap until 6-8 pm when we would head back out for paseo. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, helpful and spoke English. They provide an internet cable for access in your room (high speed) or wireless in the lobby. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We saved the best for last with Hotel Meninas”
Reviews.Author: seattle2sf
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a two week Europe vacation. We visited four cities, stayed at four hotels. Madrid was our last stop and Hotel Meninas was our favorite hotel. We only stayed two nights and wished we could have stayed a couple of more nights. Hotel Meninas was highly recommended by trip advisor, our travel book and several travel articles. It also helped that it was very affordable (booked on Hotel Meninas website). We stayed at room 407, facing the courtyard. Our room was spacious. The hotel we stayed in Sevila was so small so we were expecting a small room as well in Madrid. We a lot of room to walk around. Room was clean. Bed is very comfortable, we also took siestas as it was too hot to sight see in the afternoon. Unfortunately the sink in the bathroom did not drain fast enough and the remote was not working (batteries needed to be replaced). We addressed them with the front desk and they fixed it after we returned home from dinner. The location is very close to Plaza Mayor and other sites. The hotel binder that was placed in every room was quite helpful and detailed. It listed the sites close by the hotel (this was my first time in Madrid). It's also walking distance to the subway station. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Hotel Meninas and wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty boutique hotel but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ajespana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pretty and in a great location. The room was large with a separate living area. The downside is the noise. We faced the street and it was super noisy. It could be because they were evicting residents from an apartment but I am not sure. Try to get a room away from the street. This could be hard because it is a smaller hotel. Also, free internet and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The design that your need!”
Reviews.Author: WessFabry
Reviews.Content: Very well hotel! The standard room is beautiful, exactly large enough for two, but the bed is small. the hotel has been lain central and near an metro station that easily access gives up to all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: pr0fumo
Reviews.Content: Following a week holidaying in one of the coastal areas of spain, we had 3 days in madrid and booked to stayy at meninas. We booked well in advance and at the time of booking, requested a double room, and an early check in as our flight from alicante arrived in madrid at 7.45am. We were told that this would be fine. We arrived at the hotel shortly before 9am, by the way, if you're looking to get into the centre of madrid, i'd suggest checking the price of the private car/limo service within the airport, we got into madrid using this service for €23, dropping us right at the door of the hotel, whereas the taxi driver outside the airport building wanted €35. When we got to the hotel, we were told that there wasnt a room ready, but that we could leave our bags there while we went for breakfast, and to return in an hour. We got back to the hotel at 10am, and were given the keys to a room on the 3rd floor, we got to the room, which was front facing, and really lovely, although it was a twin room. We went back downstairs to reception and were told that they didnt have a double room ready yet, but to take a seat and they'd get us one as soon as they can. Almost 2 hours later, we were given a double room, which wasn't front facing, but was really nice. There was a huge double wardrobe, lots of storage space, tv, dvd player etc. The bed was one of the most comfortable bed's i've slept in! the bathroom was lovely too, although the seal around the shower clearly needed replacing as was really grubby looking, however the shower as a whole was clean. There were a few water marks on the ceiling in the bathroom, and an hour before our departure, we noticed water dripping through the ceiling. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice. Lots of different breads and bread rolls, scrambled and boiled eggs, sausages, bacon etc. Plenty of cereal and fresh fruit and an amazing array of caked pastries and juices. The location was also really good, a few minutes walk takes you to the royal palace, the plaza mayor and the prado to name but a few. I'd recommend not eating in or around the plaza mayor as the places were generally very touristy and a bit overpriced. Have a walk through the streets and you'll find something nicer elsewhere. All in all, an excellent trip and an excellent hotel. I would stay here again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Lori088
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Las Meninas on my own in a single room. Very small room but to be expected for Europe. The breakfast was great! I had a room facing the inner courtyard and could hear the metro periodically but it was not loud enough to disturb me. Interior decorated very nice, bed very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean and a Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl100587
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that before our trip last August we had never been to Spain. While sorting through hundreds of hotels in Madrid, I stumbled across Meninas Hotel and we were pleasantly surprised by this quaint, clean and beautiful hotel. Not only was it beautiful, but it was a great value for what we paid. Meninas is not an "American" style hotel. It gives off a very quaint and "European" feel. The hotel is well-maintained and quiet with loads of charm. Located on a quiet street in the heart of Madrid, Meninas is within walking distance of Museo Prado and just blocks from the Royal Palace. The one potential drawback? If you do not speak Spanish you may have a slight difficulty communicating with the staff. Overall though, I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great "boutique" hotel, central location and quiet”
Reviews.Author: LondonLawyer25
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Madrid at 23:00 and didn't get to the hotel until 01:00, but the concierge was friendly and welcoming, and showed us to our room quickly. We were in a twin ensuite room on the 5th (top floor). I had read that Madrid can be noisy at night, but the room was totally quiet. We didn't even hear other guests. We had a sofa bed and table in our room, ensuite shower room (larger rooms have baths I believe), desk, wardrobe and two single beds. The room had 2 large windows, and felt bright and airy. The decor is simple yet pleasant. The breakfasts are served from 7am-11am, which is great if you are business (or on holiday and only crawling in at 4am!) They provide continental style breads and pastries, lots of fresh fruit, cooked eggs, bacon, sausage, cereals etc. We always tanked up on breakfast, which kept us going for most of the day! We booked through the hotel website, which ensures your breakfast is included, whereas if you book through Expedia, breakfast is often not included and is 15 euro each. You can hear the Metro passing underneath in the basement breakfast room, so if you are a light sleeper, ask for an upper floor room. There is wifi in the rooms and a PC in the lobby area where you can check emails, flights etc if you don't have your laptop with you. The hotel is located between Opera and Orient and is therefore very central. We walked everywhere and didn't even need to use the Metro. From Opera Metro station, turn out of the steps to the right and follow round the (current) construction site between the safety boards on Plaza de Isabelle II and the theatre. Carry on up Calle de Camponanes (the street straight ahead, which slopes slightly upwards), and Meninas is about half way up the road. You can walk round the other way past Burger King, but it is slightly longer. Meninas' sister hotel, Hotel Opera, has a spa/sauna that guests are welcome to use (but we didn't get time to use it).
