The staff were very helpful and spent a lot of time showing us where to go on a map and also printed our boarding passes for us so we could check in quickly and spend more time in Madrid on our departure day. They have larger family rooms, twin rooms and double rooms. There only appeared to be 5 rooms on each of the 5 guest floors, so only 25 guest rooms, which gave this place a "boutique" like feel. I would recommend this hotel highly as a great and not too expensive place to stay in fabulous Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian-girl
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nites with husband and thoroughly enjoyed it. a pretty little hotel on a quaint side street, there were loud noises from revelers into the wee hours (bring earplugs). location was just right, staff was helpful and breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Chic”
Reviews.Author: KensingtonLass
Reviews.Content: Fabulous chic hotel in the centre of Madrid with very modern decor. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was served in the trendy cellar bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with lots of style!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotteuse263
Reviews.Content: Las Meninas is a cute little boutique hotel in the very centre of Madrid. It is ideal for sightseeing or shopping trips. I would not recommend it for business, the desk is really small to work on and the single rooms are rather small and a little dark, facing the patio. I stayed there for 3 nights and it was clean and comfortable. The stylemix of new and old is really nice, the rooms are modern with a nice bathroom. Everything is a little on the small side, but this is Madrid. I would not recommend to eat breakfast in the hotel. I did that once and it was really not good. Anyway you can have breakfast in every bar in Spain! One thing that bothered me was the music in the corridors. The receptionist put the music on at 8 h in the morning on a sunday and it was so loud that I woke. I complained and the turned it off immediately. Music in corridors is not necessary and just bothering guest. Great hotel if you get a twin room facing the street. But this is Madrid, the centre is a little noisy everywhere. If you like supersilent hotelrooms, better not stay in the centre. Madrid never sleeps.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Historic Gem”
Reviews.Author: MaryGoody
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel was a GEM in Madrid. Situated in the Opera section of the city, we were in close proximity to the Royal Palace and many historic sights. Thanks to some negative comments about hotels in the nearby areas, we found HOTEL MENINAS. We are so lucky we did. We were upgraded to room 501. The room was a suite with all the modern conveniences. In the lobby was free internet for guests. The small size (37 rooms) made this a quaint oasis in a large city. Nearby were several Tapas bars and fine restaurants. We travel a great deal and this was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: samjoy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights in September from the 14th to the 17th. The hotel was brilliant and couldn't do enough for us. We travelled extremely early on the Friday morning and the check in was extremely quick. I had read a couple of reviews before I went that said that the hotel was noisy. The rooms are in fact soundproofed so it is not the sound from the adjoining rooms that you hear but noise from the corridor. We weren't too bothered about this as we had travelled to madrid to experience the amazing nightlife it has to offer. Maybe if you were wanting an early night or were light sleepers this hotel wouldn't be for you. This hotel is set in the heart of madrid with everything you could wish on your doorstep. The rooms are extremely modern and minimalistic. The staff are more than helpful and the breakfast good. All in all an amazing hotel for anyone who wishes to sample the nightlife and also see a bit of the true character of Madrid during the day.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience I have ever had!!”
Reviews.Author: shuyi
Reviews.Content: The worst staff I have ever met, mischarged, bad attitude and didn't respect their customer at all. I made a reservation directly from the website of the hotel Meninas, 3 nights June 28th-July 1st. Due to some reason I had to change my reservation to July 1st for just one night, so I called the hotel. When the lady heard me talking in English she put me on hold. Quite a few minutes went by and I could hear she wasn't talking to any one and just put my phone on the desk, I said hello for several times but she didn't answer. I was calling from overseas costing a lot so I hung up and called again, as soon as she heard that it was me again she hung up without saying anything, then I kept calling for at least 12 times ( not exaggerating) and she hung up every single time. At last a man picked up, so I talked to him and he transfered to the lady again. I said "please don't hang up" for 3 times and finally she talked. She didn't speak English well, I had to say the same things several times, and spelled my name 3 times. Finally she changed my reservation on Saturday. I had her repeat my final reservation and she even said "don't worry, it is fine now." I made an mistake didn't get her name and ended the call. When I arrived, they told me I was being charged because of no show, and of course my reservation was canceled. Turned out she never changed my reservation. I explained the situation and they told me it was not possible because they didn't accept any change of reservation via phone, every employee knew that so I must be wrong. I told them exactly when I called, what happened, and they just kept saying it was not possible, and refused to tell me who was the lady that day. In the end, no one was in charge of this problem, of course, and the manager gave me a card told me to talked to the Director - Pedro Alonso Gimeno- on Monday, July 2nd. I wasn't in Madrid so I had to call him (wasting lots of money again). The first call I didn't even finish talking he said something extremely fast, which I didn't understand a word, and hung up! I called again told him to listen, and this time he knew what happened, but during the whole time he wouldn't let me talk at all, he always spoke when I was talking, never listened, kept saying the same thing- this was not possible, and he CHOSE TO BELIEVE HIS EMPLOYEE, MEANT I WAS LYING. He didn't even check with the person who worked that day and just said that. I also wrote an email about every detail of my reservation and what happened, but I never got any answer, nor any phone call. My credit card was charged on June 28th, when I was still in the airplane. This is a hotel full of people who don't respect their customers at all. I strongly recommend everyone DO NOT STAY AT THE HOTEL MENINAS.

Reviews.Title: “CAUTION Mega Noise”
Reviews.Author: Catherine K
Reviews.Content: I usually only post positive reviews, however-I don't want this to happen to anyone else WARNING I have stayed at many center of Madrid hotels in my last 20+ visits in 5 yrs. I have stayed right on the Grand Via several times, the noisiest area if your hotel does not have sound proofing. I chose Meninas as I knew the small side street they were located off of Plaza Opera. My reservation was made several weeks prior, with a request for a quiet room off the street and a bath. I arrived, and was given the last room in the hotel, which was directly one floor up from the street, directly above reception/entrance, and only a non-enclosed shower with a promise I could move in the AM. I tried the room-the noise was unbelievable-alternating between football match cheering and disco-directly outside. I'd spent a long work week prior with little sleep, and begged to move to another hotel. Was told I could for one night but then would have to move back to a different room. I decided to stick it out-but after that night I spent the morning packing my bags as no way could I go thru another night sounding like I was sleeping on the street. I dearly love Madrid, I love noisy happy Spaniards-this was too much. Decided to NOT bother changing rooms as was told they only had ONE room with a bath in the entire hotel and it was taken-I moved to another hotel. Website does not reflect 'showers' only. UPSIDE-the boutique hotel has great potential! It is nicely decorated, new amenities, clean, good location. All they need is to invest in exterior sound proof shutters like Hotel Preciados-located in an extremely noisy area off Gran Via, but so quiet when exterior shutters are closed. Old syle windows and wood shutter charm is still preserved. Baths would be a welcome plus for tired travelers. Meninas Staff was pleasant. If you are late night partier, like to be part of the action and don't mind loud street noise all night-go for it. Be aware that other lodgers will be slamming doors in the loud corridor at 8AM and you'll hear every word of their conversation. Love tripadvisor! Always helps me make great choices in hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, but not for a romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: ilonanita
Reviews.Content: The rooms seen on the website and the general feeling (incl location) made this an appearantly great destination. All is new & in great condition, no complaints about cleanliness etc. Unfortunately, all double rooms (with double bed) are in shoe-box like dark rooms with windows that should not be called windows. (they look to the inner box that is not even a courtyard & the blinds are hideous). Altogether, great design in the entrance hall, funky and lots of colours. The designer however missed to create any kind of welcoming feeling in the hotel rooms themselves. It felt dark, and not inspiring. Not advisable for a romantic holiday. However, all staff and esp. the manager were very understanding and helpful and announced they have plans to change the layout of the rooms, i.e. put double beds in the nicer bigger rooms (which only have twin beds for now). Again, great location. Atmosphere missing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: kad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 6 October, just for one night - we did not choose to stay here but ended up spending the night because there was a problem with the hotel we had booked (Hotel Preciados). By the time we got there, we were tired and fed up at being moved somewhere else, so were prepared to be thoroughly disappointed. We were instead pleasantly surprised: it was not as good as the Preciados (3* not 4*) but, if the worst had come to the worst and we had had to stay there for our entire stay, it would not have been too much of a hardship. The hotel is on a quiet street, nothing much to look at from the outside but close to the metro (Plaza de Santo Domingo) and the Gran Via/Sol area. The reception area is tiny but the people on the desk (one at night, different one in the morning) were pleasant. The room was not large but was clean and had everything we needed. It was minimalist and modern in style, the bed was comfy and had feather pillows (bliss!). The shower room was not large but there was a double-sized shower and the water pressure was excellent, a real wake-you-up for the morning! We had an internal room (the window looked onto a central courtyard) but I cannot imagine that any of the rooms would have much bother from street noise - the only thing was that we appeared to be over an underground station as there was a periodic rumbling but, with the air con going, it was hardly noticeable. Breakfast was all self-service but there was plenty of choice (cereal, yoghurt, breads, cold cheese/meat/tortilla and pastries) and you could help yourself to as much coffee/tea/juice as you wanted. I have no idea how much this hotel cost (we were paying about GBP 90 for each night in the Preciados so I presume this would be cheaper). If you want a decent 3* hotel in a central location, this would fit the bill nicely.
